0.title: Maxwell key part of our team, just needs free mindset: Hazlewood
0.article_body: Talking about teammate Glenn Maxwell's form ahead of the 2022 T20 World Cup, Australia pacer Josh Hazlewood said the all-rounder is a key part of their team who adds "balance". Hazlewood added, "I think Maxwell just (needs a) free mindset and (to) play his game." Notably, Maxwell hasn't scored in double-digits in his last six T20I innings.

1.title: Amazon to launch internet satellites on ULA rocket in early 2023
1.article_body: Amazon will launch its first two prototype satellites for a planned internet-from-space constellation in early 2023. A new rocket from Boeing-Lockheed's United Launch Alliance (ULA) will be used. The prototype satellites will be part of Amazon's Kuiper network, which is a planned constellation of 3,236 low-Earth orbiting satellites that will beam broadband internet to the world's remote parts.

2.title: RBI to submit report on failure to tackle inflation since January
2.article_body: The RBI will have to submit a report to the Centre giving detailed reasons for the failure to contain prices even as inflation has been above the upper tolerance limit for nine straight months. This will be the first time since the onset of the Monetary Policy Framework in 2016 that the RBI will be asked to explain its actions.

3.title: Hyd Police shares list of roads to avoid due to heavy traffic
3.article_body: The Hyderabad Traffic Police shared list of roads to avoid due to heavy flow of traffic and peak hours. The police asked commuters to avoid roads near Taj Mahal Hotel, Apollo Hospital lane, BVB Jn, Journalist Colony and Road No 45 towards Jubilee Hills Checkpost. Traffic was hit in several areas on Wednesday night after heavy rain lashed the city.

4.title: Man gets ₹201 back from stranger he had helped last year; chat goes viral
4.article_body: A post by a LinkedIn user named Kamal Singh about receiving ₹201 from a stranger whom he had helped last year has gone viral. "On opening the chat I saw I transferred money to this guy 1.5 years back as a small help after reading his crowdfunding request on [social media]," Singh wrote along with a screenshot of their chat.

5.title: Gunshots fired at anti-hijab protestors in several Iranian cities
5.article_body:
Gunshots were fired as Iranian security forces confronted anti-hijab protestors in several cities on Wednesday. Protests are taking place in Iran over the death of 22-year-old woman Mahsa Amini. 
Amini died on September 16, days after being detained by Iran's morality police over improper hijab. Iran's Supreme Leader Ali Khamenei has accused the country's "enemies" of stoking "street riots".

6.title: Can lead to 3rd world war: Russia on admission of Ukraine to NATO
6.article_body: The admission of Ukraine to the North Atlantic Treaty Organization (NATO) can result in third world war, the deputy secretary of the Security Council of the Russian Federation, Alexander Venediktov, has said. Venediktov also repeated a Russian position that the West, by helping Ukraine, indicated that "they are a direct party to the conflict".

7.title: Need for new laws to curb superstition: CPI(M) on Kerala's human sacrifice case
7.article_body: The CPI(M) condemned the alleged human sacrifice incident reported in Kerala and said that there's need for new laws to curb such superstitious practices and urged strict implementation of the existing laws. Such an incident, which shocked human conscience, cannot be prevented by law alone but a mass public movement should emerge in society against such practices, the party added.

8.title: Auto-rickshaw driver arrested for molesting school student in Delhi
8.article_body: A 25-year-old auto-rickshaw driver was arrested from Delhi's Saket area for allegedly molesting a school student, police said. The incident took place on September 30, police added. The accused misbehaved with the girl by passing lewd and sexual comments, and also touched her inappropriately while she was on her way to meet her mother in Lajpat Nagar, police stated.

9.title: Priest stops Dalit youth from entering temple in Karnataka
9.article_body: A Dalit youth was reportedly stopped from entering the Mulkatamma temple by the priest in Karnataka's Tumakuru district. He said he went to the temple with flowers, coconut and incense sticks to pray but the priest refused to take the offerings and threw him out. The locals accused the priest of practising untouchability.

10.title: Musk sells $1 million worth of 'Burnt Hair' perfume within hours of launch
10.article_body: The world's richest person Elon Musk earned a million dollars within a few hours after he sold 10,000 bottles of his newly-launched 'Burnt Hair' perfume. Musk also changed his Twitter bio to 'perfume salesman' and on Thursday tweeted, "Please buy my perfume, so I can buy Twitter." The perfume is priced at $100 and being sold under The Boring Company.

11.title: 700 stubble burning incidents reported so far in 2022: Punjab minister
11.article_body: As many as 700 incidents of stubble burning have been reported in Punjab so far this year, state’s Agriculture Minister Kuldeep Singh Dhaliwal said on Wednesday. "This year 700 incidents...reported…as compared to over 2,500 incidents during the same time in previous years," Dhaliwal added. "We're constantly trying that stubble should not be burnt at least in Punjab," he stated.

12.title: Russia to use its own nuclear fuel at Zaporizhzhia plant: Rosenergoatom
12.article_body: The Zaporizhzhia nuclear power plant will switch to Russian nuclear fuel after its current reserves run out, Russia's nuclear power operator Rosenergoatom reportedly said. This comes after Ukraine's nuclear energy company Energoatom accused Russia of not allowing its vehicles carrying diesel fuel to access the plant. The plant had suffered a "blackout" which increased radiation emergency risk.

13.title: 2 women jailed for husbands' murder observing Karwa Chauth fast in UP
13.article_body: About 50 women prisoners in Lucknow and 12 in Gorakhpur are observing Karwa Chauth fast after the UP government permitted them to perform all rituals associated with the festival. Among those fasting are two women prisoners accused in the murder of their husbands. Married couples who are in jail will be allowed to meet on the occasion, said an official.

14.title: I'm speechless: Tanushree on Sajid Khan's participation in 'Bigg Boss 16'
14.article_body: Actress Tanushree Dutta said she's "speechless" about filmmaker Sajid Khan's entry as a contestant in Salman Khan's show 'Bigg Boss 16'. "I am appalled too. I am speechless at the sheer irresponsibility of this action and the impact it would have on the public," she said. Several women accused Sajid Khan of sexual misconduct during the #MeToo movement in India.

15.title: Hindalco, NALCO shares rise as US mulls Russian aluminium ban
15.article_body: After aluminium prices surged nearly 7.3% on the London Metal Exchange following reports of the US considering a ban on Russian aluminium amid the Russia-Ukraine war, stock prices of Hindalco, Vedanta and NALCO rose by 1.5-3%. NALCO rose by 3.28% in opening trade on the National Stock Exchange, while Hindalco was up 3.5% and Vedanta surged by 1.2%.

16.title: Dalljiet reacts as ex-husband and BB16 participant Shalin says they are best friends
16.article_body: Actress Dalljiet Kaur has reacted after her ex-husband and Bigg Boss 16 participant Shalin Bhanot said they're best friends during an episode of the reality show. "No I'm not your best friend...Meeting once in...two months for the sake of my child does not qualify as friendship," she added. "Leave me out of your fictions and stories please," she further said.

17.title: Pic shows smoke-filled cabin of SpiceJet flight after it makes emergency landing in Hyd
17.article_body: A Twitter user shared an image of a smoke-filled cabin of a SpiceJet flight after the plane made an emergency landing at Hyderabad airport on Wednesday night due to the incident. While sharing two videos of the landing, he also said that the passengers "suffered" and had "blacked out with fear". According to officials, DGCA is probing the incident.

18.title: Google approves Donald Trump's app Truth Social for Play Store
18.article_body: Google has approved former US President Donald Trump's social media application Truth Social for distribution in the Google Play Store, a company spokesperson said. Truth Social had not been available in the Play Store due to insufficient content moderation, a Google spokesperson said in August. Donald Trump launched Truth Social after he was permanently banned from Twitter in January 2021.

19.title: Mercedes-Benz sees 28% rise in sales in India in Jan-Sept 2022
19.article_body: Mercedes-Benz India has registered 28% rise in sales, with 11,469 units sold in Jan-Sept 2022, the company said. The German carmaker sold 8,958 units in India in the same period last year. The statement added that the total order bank of Mercedes-Benz India as of September 2022 is over 7,000 units. The company sold 11,242 units in India in 2021.

20.title: Vedanta shareholders approve shifting its cash from reserves
20.article_body: The shareholders of Anil Agarwal-led Vedanta Limited on Tuesday approved Vedanta Resources' proposal to move money out of its reserves and into its balance sheet. London-based Vedanta Resources holds about 70% stake in Vedanta Limited. Vedanta said in a regulatory filing that 100% of Promoter and Promoter Group shareholders as well as public institutions voted in favour of the proposal.

21.title: Car rental startup Zoomcar may go public via SPAC deal: Report
21.article_body: Bengaluru-based car rental startup Zoomcar has reportedly reached an agreement to go public via a merger with blank-cheque firm, Innovative International Acquisition Corporation. The merger with a special purpose acquisition company (SPAC) implies a pro forma enterprise value of about $456 million for the business. Zoomcar was founded by Greg Moran and David Back in 2013.

22.title: Bengaluru likely to see rain for the rest of the week: Forecast
22.article_body: Bengaluru will see moderate to heavy rain today with thunderstorms and lightning, the Karnataka State Natural Disaster Monitoring Centre (KSNDMC) said. Meanwhile, Skymet Weather Services said that the city will likely see rainfall throughout the week. Areas within BBMP limits will have maximum and minimum temperatures around 28 and 21 degrees Celsius respectively, state's weather department said.

23.title: Assured placement with Gaming & eSports certificate program: Hero Vired
23.article_body: Hero Vired & NODWIN Gaming has launched a Certificate Program in Gaming and eSports with placement assurance. Individuals in their final year or with bachelor's degrees & experienced professionals are eligible to apply, the company said. It enables candidates to explore gaming & eSports industry with hands-on learning on various aspects like UI/UX, game mechanics, league ops, and game marketing.

24.title: Love the kind of thriller stories Sriram Raghavan tells: Katrina Kaif
24.article_body: Actress Katrina Kaif said she loves the kind of thriller stories director Sriram Raghavan tells and called him one of her favourite directors. The actress has collaborated with Raghavan for the first time for his upcoming film 'Merry Christmas', which also features Vijay Sethupathi. Talking about working with Sethupathi, Kaif said he is "a phenomenal actor".

25.title: 46-yr-old man sexually assaults 6-yr-old girl in Mumbai; arrested
25.article_body: A 46-year-old man has been arrested for allegedly sexually assaulting a six-year-old girl in Mumbai's Kandivali West. The girl was playing near her house when the accused, a welder, reportedly took her to a deserted place and sexually assaulted her behind a tree. He also beat up the child and threatened her against telling anyone about the incident, said police.

26.title: You see that guy? I'd pick Umran in the squad all the time: Wasim Akram
26.article_body: Ex-Pakistan captain Wasim Akram has said he would've picked pacer Umran Malik in his squad all the time. "You see that guy? Umran...he's quick...The more he plays, the better he will become," stated Wasim. Umran has played three T20Is for India so far and has reportedly been shortlisted as one of the net bowlers for the upcoming T20 World Cup.

27.title: UN demands Russia to reverse 'illegal' annexations in Ukraine
27.article_body: The UN General Assembly has voted 143-5 to condemn Russia's "attempted illegal annexation" of four Ukrainian regions and demand its immediate reversal. Russia formally annexed Ukraine's Donetsk, Luhansk, Kherson and Zaporizhzhia regions through referendums which the West dismissed as a sham. Ukraine's UN ambassador, Sergiy Kyslytsya, called the vote at UN "amazing" and "a historic moment".

28.title: Family sacrifices 14-yr-old daughter in Gujarat for 'financial benefits'
28.article_body: A family in Gujarat's Gir Somnath district allegedly killed their 14-year-old daughter as a "sacrifice for financial benefits", police said. The girl was studying in Surat till six months ago, police added. Her parents, for unknown reasons, took her leaving certificate from the school and brought her to their native village and kept her at the farm, police added.

29.title: Matter of choice, nothing more, nothing less: Judge in K'taka hijab ban split verdict
29.article_body: The Supreme Court on Thursday delivered a split verdict in the Karnataka hijab ban case. While Justice Hemant Gupta dismissed the appeals challenging the Karnataka High Court order, Justice Sudhanshu Dhulia said, "The high court took a wrong path...It's ultimately a matter of choice, nothing more, nothing else. Uppermost in my mind was the education of the girl child."

30.title: Emily Ratajkowski says she's 'single' amid relationship rumours with Brad Pitt
30.article_body: Supermodel Emily Ratajkowski has confirmed that she is "single" amid the rumours that she was seeing Hollywood actor Brad Pitt. "I'm newly single for basically the first time in my life ever," she said in her latest interview. Emily added she is "enjoying the freedom of not being super worried" about how she is being perceived.

31.title: Peace visible on ground due to PM's special focus on Kashmir: MoS Finance
31.article_body: Minister of State (MoS) for Finance Pankaj Chaudhary on Wednesday said PM Narendra Modi’s special focus on Kashmir is bearing fruits as peace is visible on the ground. Furthermore, he said that it’s due to PM Modi’s vision that central ministers are meeting stakeholders by visiting them at their doorsteps as a part of government’s public outreach programme in J&K.

32.title: Will consult Sonia, Rahul if elected as Congress President: Kharge
32.article_body: Congress Presidential poll candidate Mallikarjun Kharge on Wednesday said that he believes in collective leadership and if elected as party’s chief, he will consult party leaders Sonia Gandhi and Rahul Gandhi on organisational matters. "Under their leadership, our party had formed government twice and framed a number of welfare schemes for the poor," Kharge added.

33.title: Liverpool's Mohamed Salah scores fastest hat-trick in Champions League history
33.article_body: Liverpool forward Mohamed Salah on Wednesday scored the fastest hat-trick in the history of Champions League. The 30-year-old Egyptian came on as a substitute against Rangers in the 68th minute and netted his three goals in the 75th, 80th and 81st minutes, respectively. He set the record by scoring the hat-trick in under seven minutes.

34.title: There's a vibe of extreme nervousness at home: Shaheen on Alia's pregnancy
34.article_body: Alia Bhatt's sister Shaheen Bhatt shared that there's "a vibe of extreme nervousness and excited anticipation" at home about the actress' pregnancy. "Alia is the first among us, siblings, who will be welcoming a baby," Shaheen said, adding that the whole family is "waiting to meet the new member". Alia had announced her pregnancy in June this year.

35.title: Ukraine says it 'shot down 4 Russian helicopters' in 18 mins
35.article_body: Ukraine's Defence Ministry said that the country's forces in a span of just 18 minutes shot down four Russian helicopters "that were spoiling beautiful autumn skies in the south of Ukraine" on Wednesday. The aircraft, believed to be Soviet-era Ka-52 helicopters, were providing fire support to the ground occupation forces, Ukraine's Air Force said. Russia began invading Ukraine in February.

36.title: Wipro shares fall 6% to hit fresh 52-week low after Q2 results
36.article_body: Wipro shares fell 6% to hit a fresh 52-week low of ₹383.25 apiece on the BSE on Thursday after it reported a consolidated net profit of ₹2,659 crore for the second quarter, which was 9% less than the corresponding period last year. Its revenue from operations increased by 14.60%. Wipro gave a revenue growth guidance of 0.2-2% for October-December quarter.

37.title: IHH Healthcare starts talks with SEBI on Fortis open offer: Report
37.article_body: Malaysia's IHH Healthcare has started discussions with authorities in India, including SEBI to explore the next step for its stalled open offer for an additional 26.1% stake in Fortis Healthcare, The Economic Times cited sources as saying. The Supreme Court had in September ordered a forensic audit of the share sale of Fortis to IHH Healthcare executed in 2018.

38.title: India defeat Thailand, reach Women's Asia Cup T20 final for the 4th time in a row
38.article_body: Two-time champions India defeated first-time semi-finalists Thailand by 74 runs on Thursday to reach the Women's Asia Cup T20 final for the fourth time in a row. Batting first, India posted a total of 148/6, with opener Shafali Verma top-scoring with 42(28). India restricted Thailand to 74/9 in their 20 overs, with Deepti Sharma registering figures of 4-1-7-3.

39.title: Don't have any other babies looming, my peers told me to have 500 kids: Musk
39.article_body: On being asked if he's fathered any more children, Tesla CEO Elon Musk said, "I'm pretty sure there are no other babies looming." During an interview with The Financial Times, Musk said that some of his peers have told him to have 500 children, adding that he thinks it would be a "bit weird".

40.title: Hyderabad-bound SpiceJet flight lands safely after smoke detected in cabin
40.article_body: A Goa-Hyderabad SpiceJet flight landed safely at its destination after smoke was detected in the cabin during the descent on Wednesday. While all passengers were safely disembarked, as per airport sources, a female passenger fell ill due to the incident and is currently undergoing treatment. A total of 86 passengers were said to be on board.

41.title: Bail plea of accused in Delhi riots larger conspiracy case rejected
41.article_body: A Delhi court on Wednesday rejected the bail plea of Athar Khan, an accused in the larger conspiracy case in connection with the 2020 Delhi riots. "On the perusal of the charge-sheet and accompanying documents...allegations against the accused Athar Khan are prima facie true," the court said. Khan had purportedly told others that the time has come to "burn Delhi".

42.title: PM Modi flags off 4th Vande Bharat Express train from Himachal's Una
42.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi inaugurated India's fourth Vande Bharat Express train from Himachal Pradesh's Una railway station on Thursday. The train, which will run between Una and New Delhi, accelerates to 100 km per hour in just 52 seconds. Himachal Pradesh CM Jairam Thakur, Railways Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw and Union Minister Anurag Thakur were also present during the event.

43.title: Babar Azam must come out of average mindset, think big: Shahid Afridi
43.article_body: Former Pakistan captain Shahid Afridi has criticised Babar Azam, stating that the Pakistan captain "must come out of [the] average mindset and think big". Afridi made the comment in response to Babar's remarks before Pakistan's match against Bangladesh in the ongoing tri-series in Christchurch. Babar had said he was considering giving Bangladesh a target of 160 runs.

44.title: Supreme Court delivers split verdict in Karnataka hijab ban case
44.article_body: The Supreme Court gave a split verdict in the Karnataka hijab ban case as one of the judges said there was a "divergence in opinion". While Justice Hemant Gupta dismissed the petitions challenging the Karnataka High Court order and upheld the hijab ban in educational institutions in the state, Justice Sudhanshu Dhulia said, "Wearing hijab is a matter of choice".

45.title: Cyber frauds can now be reported at all 32 police stations in Pune
45.article_body: Citizens will now be able to file cyber fraud complaints at all the 32 police stations in Pune, said Commissioner Amitabh Gupta on Wednesday. Earlier, people had to travel to the cybercrime police station at Shivajinagar headquarters for it. "We have trained the staff at all police stations about how to investigate cybercrime cases," said Police Inspector Kumar Ghadge.

46.title: Two arrested for smuggling over 30,000 packs of illegal cigarettes in GB Nagar
46.article_body: The Gautam Buddha Nagar unit of Uttar Pradesh Special Task Force arrested two people on Wednesday for smuggling over 30,000 packets of illegal cigarettes, worth ₹1.5 crore. The police arrested the suspects from the Pilkhuwa toll plaza in Hapur and recovered 21,200 packets of cigarettes from Indonesia and 9,000 packets from South Korea, along with a truck.

47.title: Kohli reacts to on-field situations, Rohit prepares in meetings: NZ's Corey
47.article_body: Talking about the captaincy approach of Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma, ex-NZ all-rounder Corey Anderson, who played under both the players in IPL, said, "Virat...sees things as they are and then goes by that. Rohit [is] involved in a lot of those meetings." Corey added, "I think Rohit is sort of just very proactive around how he does things."

48.title: Europe is likely entering another COVID-19 wave, warns WHO
48.article_body: The World Health Organization and European Centre for Disease Prevention and Control (ECDC) said there are indicators suggesting that another wave of COVID-19 infections has begun in Europe. "Although we're not where we were one year ago, it's clear that...COVID-19 pandemic is still not over," WHO Europe Director Hans Kluge and ECDC Director Andrea Ammon said in a joint statement.

49.title: Massive fire breaks out at film studio in Kolkata, 15 fire tenders deployed
49.article_body: A massive fire broke out at Eskay Movies studio in the Kudghat area in West Bengal's Kolkata on Thursday morning. With 15 fire tenders pressed into action, the fire was brought under control, fire officials said. Kolkata Police's disaster management force reached the spot where minister Aroop Biswas was also present. The fire reportedly broke out in the studio's godown.

50.title: Queen Elizabeth's life features in new comic book; pics surface
50.article_body: The life of Queen Elizabeth, Britain's longest-reigning monarch, has featured in a new comic book by TidalWave Comics. The comic book covers her public and private life, big events, family scandals, and crises. She passed away on September 8 aged 96 and was laid to rest alongside her husband Prince Philip on September 19.

51.title: Would love to make biopic on Big B, but there’s no one to play him: Balki
51.article_body: Director R Balki said he would love to make a biopic on Amitabh Bachchan but he thinks there's no one who can play him on screen. "There's not a single actor in this country who would dare to step into those shoes," he said, adding that even Abhishek wouldn't play his father on screen. "He knows it's impossible," Balki added.

52.title: Electronics dealer in Pune cheats finance firm of ₹22.74 lakh
52.article_body: An electronics and home appliance dealer in Pune allegedly cheated a finance company of ₹22.74 lakh. The accused, Pritesh Shivale, used customers' documents to avail loans from the company, according to police. When the monthly instalments were deducted from customers' accounts, they denied having purchased any home appliances. Shivale is suspected to have cheated 80 to 90 customers.

53.title: HCL disapproves dual employment, says moonlighting not a 'big issue within firm'
53.article_body: Speaking on the issue of moonlighting, HCL Technologies said that while it doesn’t approve "dual employment", it has not been a major issue within the company. HCL's Chief People Officer Ramachandran Sundararajan said, "Everybody who signs up to work for HCL…is signing up employment contract which requires exclusivity." Earlier, Wipro fired 300 employees found to be moonlighting.

54.title: Admired Emma in a way I could never explain: 'Harry Potter' star Tom Felton
54.article_body: 'Harry Potter' actor Tom Felton said he "loved and admired" his co-star Emma Watson in a way he could never explain to anybody else. "I've always had a secret love for Emma, though not perhaps in the way that people might want to hear," he said, adding there was "most definitely" a spark between the two, but at different times.

55.title: North Korea test-fires 2 cruise missiles capable of carrying nuclear weapons
55.article_body: North Korean leader Kim Jong-un oversaw the test launch of two nuclear-capable long-range strategic cruise missiles, state media reported. The two missiles flew for 10,234 seconds and "clearly hit the target 2,000 km away". The state media added that test was aimed at "enhancing the combat efficiency and might" of cruise missiles deployed "for operation of tactical nukes".

56.title: BJP only national party left, Cong reduced to brother-sister organisation: Nadda
56.article_body: BJP National President JP Nadda said BJP is the only national party left in the country, while Congress has reduced to a "party of a brother and sister". "There's no other national party left. I say this with full responsibility that Congress has shrunk and it's neither a national party nor a Bharatiya party," Nadda added.

57.title: Vistadome coaches in Mumbai trains generate ₹7.32 cr revenue in 6 months
57.article_body: Around 56,895 passengers travelled in Vistadome coaches installed in several Mumbai trains in the last six months and generated ₹7.32 crore in revenue during this time. Mumbai-Madgaon Jan Shatabdi Express alone generated revenue of ₹3.35 crore with 16,078 Vistadome coach passengers. A few other trains which have Vistadome coaches are Mumbai-Pune Deccan Express, Deccan Queen and Pragati Express.

58.title: Sanju should be in scheme of things for ODIs, but not at cost of Pant: Jaffer
58.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Wasim Jaffer has said Sanju Samson has impressed him a lot with his recent performances and the 27-year-old should be included in the team for the ODIs. Jaffer, however, also added, "Samson should be in the scheme of things...but not at the cost of Rishabh Pant." Samson remained unbeaten in the recently-concluded South Africa ODIs.

59.title: Please buy my perfume, so I can buy Twitter, says Musk; Twitter users react
59.article_body: After offering to buy Twitter again, the world's richest person Elon Musk recently launched a new business venture, a 'Burnt Hair' perfume. On Thursday, he tweeted, "Please buy my perfume, so I can buy Twitter." Meanwhile, a Twitter user commented, "Please hire me, so that I can buy a Tesla," while another wrote, "In that case, I'm buying 10."

60.title: India reports 2,786 new COVID-19 cases, active cases stand at 26,509
60.article_body: India reported 2,786 new COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country recorded 2,139 new COVID-19 cases. The active cases in India now stand at 26,509. The COVID-19 death toll so far has reached 5,28,847 following 12 casualties in the last 24 hours.

61.title: Jeev Milkha Singh gets 63 challans for Mercedes Benz car he sold in 2014 for ₹35 lakh
61.article_body: Golfer Jeev Milkha Singh has moved court in Chandigarh, seeking FIR against a car dealer and purchaser after he received court notices pertaining to 63 unpaid challans for Mercedes Benz car he sold in 2014 for ₹35 lakh. The challan violations, which have been accruing since 2015, amount to ₹83,000. He had sold the car to a Delhi-based firm director.

62.title: UP minister's nephew tries to ram his car into hotel staff for refusing to serve him food
62.article_body: An Uttar Pradesh minister's nephew was booked by the police after he allegedly tried to ram his car into a group of restaurant workers for refusing to serve him food. The hotel's owner, who claimed to be a BJP worker, said that he went to the minister’s house to complain but was asked to return as the latter was sleeping.

63.title: France accuses Russia of stoking Armenia, Azerbaijan conflict
63.article_body: French President Emmanuel Macron on Wednesday accused Russia of purposefully provoking the recent clashes between Armenia and Azerbaijan. "It's an effort by Russia to destabilise. It wants to create disorder in the Caucasus to destabilise all of us," Macron said. The worst fighting between Armenia and Azerbaijan since 2020 broke out in late September, killing more than 200 people.

64.title: It's bad, this Champions League is being cruel to us: Barca manager Xavi
64.article_body: Barcelona manager Xavi Hernandez said the ongoing Champions League is being "cruel" to them after they played out a 3-3 draw against Inter Milan on Wednesday night. Barcelona, with a single win in four games so far, are facing elimination at the group stage for the second consecutive season. "What is left for us is to...focus on LaLiga," added Xavi.

65.title: Why isn’t Cong inviting Mamata, Kejriwal to join Bharat Jodo Yatra?: Sushil Modi
65.article_body: BJP leader Sushil Modi said if Congress really wants to send a message of unity, why doesn't it invite other Opposition leaders like West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee, Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal or Telangana CM K Chandrashekar Rao to join Bharat Jodo Yatra. His statement came after Congress' Digvijaya Singh asked RJD chief Lalu Prasad Yadav to join the yatra.

66.title: PepsiCo's beverage volume posts 11% growth in September quarter
66.article_body: PepsiCo's beverage unit reported a double-digit volume growth at 11% in India for the quarter ended September and mid-single-digit growth in the convenience foods unit volume. The company's net revenue from Africa, Middle East and South Asia (AMESA) division, under which India comes, surged by 3.66% to $1.72 billion. Its operating profit declined 14% amid higher commodity and operating costs.

67.title: Manoj Joshi posts video on Air India's 'worst service' after flight gets delayed by 3 hrs
67.article_body: Actor Manoj Joshi posted a video on Twitter and wrote, "Air India flight 634 was late by 3 hours and now I'm waiting for baggage to come on belt since last 40 minutes at Mumbai airport." "There's no staff here to guide or help. I have never faced such worst service till date. They spoiled my entire day," he added.

68.title: Woman killed, 5 UP policemen injured while chasing criminal in U'khand
68.article_body: A woman was shot dead in a clash between Uttar Pradesh's Moradabad Police and residents of Bharatpur village in Uttarakhand's Udham Singh Nagar district. Notably, five UP Police personnel were also injured. Moradabad Police had gone to Uttarakhand to arrest a criminal who escaped from Bharatpur and when the UP Police team reached, they were taken hostage.

69.title: Govt forms 4-member panel to probe cough syrup-related deaths in Gambia
69.article_body: The Union Health Ministry has set up a panel under Dr Y K Gupta, Vice-Chairperson of the Standing National Committee on Medicines, and three others to investigate the deaths of 66 Gambian children purportedly caused due to cough syrups manufactured by Maiden Pharmaceuticals. Earlier, Haryana stopped the cough syrups production by the company after finding violations during inspections.

70.title: Mumbai woman cheated of ₹6.40 lakh by fake 'suitor from Finland'
70.article_body: A 44-year-old Mumbai woman was allegedly cheated of ₹6.40 lakh by a man she met on a matrimonial site, who pretended to be an eye specialist from Finland. He sent her a photograph of his flight ticket to India. However, the woman received a call saying he was caught at the airport and was asked to pay for his release.

71.title: SRK, Nayanthara to shoot Jawan's last schedule in Rajasthan: Report
71.article_body: Shah Rukh Khan and Nayanthara will reportedly shoot for the last schedule of 'Jawan' in Rajasthan. As per a report, the 20-day schedule will mark the wrap of Shah Rukh and Nayanthara's shoot for the Atlee directorial. 'Jawan' marks Shah Rukh's first collaboration with Atlee and Nayanthara. The film will release in Hindi, Tamil, Telugu, Malayalam and Kannada.

72.title: Funny how I don't have news about my life: Rakul on wedding rumours
72.article_body: Actress Rakul Preet Singh has put her wedding rumours to rest. In response to a report, which read that her brother has confirmed that marriage is on cards for Rakul and her boyfriend Jackky Bhagnani, Rakul tweeted, "It's funny how I don't have news about my life." Rakul and Jackky made their relationship official on social media platforms in 2021.

73.title: Only 27% calls to Mumbai Fire Brigade related to fire incidents
73.article_body: Of all the calls Mumbai Fire Brigade received so far this year, only 27% were related to fire incidents, as per official data. About 41% of them were rescue calls in incidents such as drowning, floods and tree collapses. Out of 6,937 emergency calls the Fire Brigade responded, 1,899 were fire incidents, while 2,833 were for rescue.

74.title: Wine shop in Hyderabad's Old City looted of cash, liquor bottles
74.article_body: A wine shop located at Chandrayangutta in Hyderabad's Old City was looted of ₹40,000 cash kept in the cash box and liquor bottles of different brands. The thieves entered the shop after making a hole in the ceiling of the shop. The police suspect that thieves scaled down into the shop using a rope and escaped through the same route.

75.title: Bhuvneshwar will probably struggle in Australia: Wasim Akram
75.article_body: Former Pakistan pacer Wasim Akram has said India pacer Bhuvneshwar Kumar is likely to struggle in Australia in the upcoming T20 World Cup. "With his pace, if the ball is not swinging, Bhuvneshwar will probably struggle...he's a very good bowler no doubt...But you need pace in Australia," he explained. Wasim also termed Suryakumar Yadav as a "very dangerous" player.

76.title: Waterlogging in underpass at Bengaluru's Kadubeesanahalli due to pipeline damage
76.article_body: Bengaluru's ORR Kadubeesanahalli Underpass witnessed severe waterlogging on Thursday morning, affecting traffic movement in the area. The Mahadevapura Task Force-Mobility shared the information on its Twitter handle and said it is suspected that the outlet drain pipeline, which is 20 feet below the road level, has been damaged during the piling work by BMRCL.

77.title: 19-yr-old girl killed in leopard attack in Pune; 2nd incident in 2 months
77.article_body: A 19-year-old girl died after she was attacked by a leopard in Pune's Shirur taluka on Wednesday, officials said. The victim was in the front yard of her house when the leopard attacked her from behind and dragged her into nearby sugarcane cultivation, police said. This is the second such incident in the area over the last two months.

78.title: There is a lot to learn from India: IMF on India's social welfare programmes
78.article_body: Calling India's deployment of a direct cash transfer scheme and other similar social welfare programmes a "logistical marvel", the IMF said, "From India, there is a lot to learn." Paolo Mauro, Deputy Director of the Fiscal Affairs Department at IMF, said these programmes that seek to help people who are at low-income levels "reach literally hundreds of millions of people".

79.title: Edtech startup FrontRow fires 75% staff; 2nd round of layoffs in 5 months
79.article_body: Bengaluru-based edtech startup FrontRow has fired 75% of its workforce, around 130 employees, and is now left with a 45-member team. This is the second round of layoffs at the company in five months as it fired 30% of employees in May. The startup counts Deepika Padukone's Family Office, Lightspeed Venture Partners and Unacademy's Gaurav Munjal among its investors.

80.title: Waterlogging spots in Pune increased from 80 to 138: PMC survey
80.article_body: The number of waterlogging spots in Pune increased from 80 last year to 138 this year, showed a survey by Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC). In contrast to the past when such spots were mostly located near slums or low-lying areas, a majority of them have been identified near housing societies this time.

81.title: NGT imposes ₹900 cr fine on Delhi over unprocessed waste at 3 landfills
81.article_body: National Green Tribunal (NGT) imposed an environmental compensation amount of ₹900 crore on Delhi government over unprocessed waste at three landfills. The quantity of undisposed waste at the landfills is three crore tonnes, as per NGT's order. The deposit is to be made within one month and the deposit will be the responsibility of the Chief Secretary, NGT said.

82.title: India abstains from UN vote on Russia's illegal annexation of Ukrainian regions
82.article_body: India abstained from voting in the UN General Assembly on a draft resolution that condemned Russia's "illegal so-called referendums" and annexation of the Donetsk, Kherson, Luhansk and Zaporizhzhia regions of Ukraine. A total of 143 members voted in favour of the resolution while five voted against it. As many as 35 members abstained from the resolution.

83.title: Video shows moment when 100-kg tyre falls off cargo plane after takeoff in Italy
83.article_body: A video has captured the moment when a 100-kg wheel fell off a Boeing 747 Dreamlifter operated by Atlas Air, right after takeoff from Taranto in Italy. A black trail of smoke could be seen coming from where the tyre snapped. The aircraft, which is mainly used for transporting Boeing 787 Dreamliner components, later landed safely in the US.

84.title: Water supply in most parts of B'luru to be disrupted on Oct 14, 15
84.article_body: Water supply in most areas of Bengaluru will be disrupted on October 14 and 15 due to maintenance work at Cauvery Water Supply Scheme Stage 1 and 2 pump houses at TK Halli, Harohalli and Tataguni. Affected areas include NTY Layout, Telecom Layout, Kasturba Nagar and Lakkasandra. Vivekananda Nagar, Chamarajpet and Kaveri Layout, among others, will also be affected.

85.title: Mumbai University students get old paper in exam due to 'technical glitch'
85.article_body: The students of various colleges associated with the University of Mumbai were offered a previous year's question paper on Wednesday, as they appeared for their second-semester exams. Mumbai University’s official spokesperson for the examination section, Vinod, claimed that it was a "technical glitch". A fresh question paper was given an hour later, the students said.

86.title: Pune college clerk cheats woman of ₹6 lakh on promise of govt job
86.article_body: Police have booked a clerk of Pune-based College of Military Engineering for allegedly cheating a woman of around ₹6 lakh on the pretext of offering her a government job in the Indian Railways in 2019. The complainant runs a canteen at INS Shivaji, where the accused was earlier posted. The complainant was shown an appointment letter while being cheated.

87.title: Gang of women thieves targeting female commuters on Delhi Metro held
87.article_body: A gang of women thieves, who used to target women commuters in the Delhi Metro, have been arrested by the Metro Police, officials said. Based on a man's complaint, police scanned CCTV footage and got clues about one of the accused. The accused confessed during questioning, following which three of her accomplices were also arrested.

88.title: 20-yr-old Mumbai boy pulls girl's dupatta with 'sexual intent'; jailed
88.article_body: A special court in Mumbai has sentenced a 20-year-old boy to three-year jail for pulling a "dupatta" (stole) of a school-going girl with "sexual intent". The victim was going to a shop when the boy pulled her dupatta and held her hand. The judge said, "[Such]...incident causes terror in...mind of people, victim and her family...and leave scar for longer time."

89.title: Delhi's landfill sites went down by 462% in just 4 months: LG office
89.article_body: Disposal of legacy waste from Delhi's landfill sites between June-September 2022 increased by 462% as compared to preceding three years, Delhi Lieutenant Governor's office said. Legacy waste at Ghazipur, Bhalswa and Okhla dropped from 229.1 lakh million tonnes (mt) in May to 203 lakh mt in September. Legacy waste at the three sites was 280 lakh mt in mid-2019.

90.title: Delhi govt increases minimum wages, new rates applicable from Oct 1
90.article_body: The Delhi government has increased the minimum wages and the new rates will be applicable from October 1, officials said on Wednesday. "Amidst the rising inflation, this is a big step taken in the interest of the labour class," said Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia, adding that Delhi has the highest minimum wages in comparison with other states.

91.title: Man hacks Mumbai Police officer's account, clears 3 passport applications
91.article_body: An unidentified person got access to the login ID and password of a Mumbai Police officer in the passport branch and cleared three applications pending verification, an official said on Wednesday. An FIR was registered against the accused for hacking into the online passport verification system managed by the Central government, he said.

92.title: 14 arrested members of PFI file plea in Delhi HC seeking compensation
92.article_body: As many as 14 arrested members of the Popular Front of India (PFI) approached the Delhi HC on Wednesday seeking their release and compensation, claiming that they were unlawfully detained. The petitioners claimed they were arrested from their homes on September 27 and weren't provided any reasons. The Centre has banned PFI and its associate outfits for five years.

93.title: India players celebrate Hardik Pandya's birthday in a small plane, Karthik shares video
93.article_body: Several Team India players including Dinesh Karthik, Rohit Sharma and Deepak Hooda celebrated all-rounder Hardik Pandya's birthday in a small plane in Australia. Sharing a video, Karthik wrote, "Celebrating birthdays on ground was too mainstream so we took it to the sky." In the video, Pandya can be seen sitting with the pilot apparently ahead of the take-off.

94.title: 5 men hack 19-year-old auto driver to death over old rivalry in Pune
94.article_body: Five men reportedly hacked a 19-year-old autorickshaw driver to death over an old rivalry in Pimpri Chinchwad on Monday evening. According to police, the deceased was driving the autorickshaw towards Rohkal when the passenger inside the auto started attacking him with a sharp weapon. Shortly, four other men in a car blocked the autorickshaw's way and attacked the driver.

95.title: Who are the top 5 batters as per latest T20I rankings?
95.article_body: New Zealand wicketkeeper-batter Devon Conway leapfrogged Australia's Aaron Finch and England's Dawid Malan to make it to fifth spot with 760 rating points in latest T20I rankings for batters. The rankings are led by Pakistan's Muhammad Rizwan (853 rating points). He's followed by India's Suryakumar Yadav (838) and Pakistan captain Babar Azam (808 points). South Africa's Aiden Markram is fourth.

96.title: Moonlighting a question of ethics, not legalities: Wipro CEO
96.article_body: On being asked whether moonlighting is legal or illegal, Wipro CEO Thierry Delaporte said, "It isn't a question of legalities, it's a question of ethics." He added, "We don't believe that it is right to have two jobs having a conflict of interest." He further said, "If other companies have no problem with that, we respect that."

97.title: India-UK FTA on 'verge of collapse' over visa comments: Report
97.article_body: After UK Home Secretary Suella Braverman questioned action over Indians overstaying their visa, the Free Trade Agreement between the two countries is on the verge of collapse, according to a UK media report. It stated that ministers of the Indian government were "shocked and dismayed" by Braverman's comments. Braverman called Indians the "largest group of people who overstay" their visas.

98.title: Ambati Rayudu, Sheldon Jackson involved in fight during match, video goes viral
98.article_body: A video has gone viral showing Baroda's Ambati Rayudu and Saurashtra's Sheldon Jackson getting involved in a fight during their Syed Mushtaq Ali Trophy match. According to the on-air commentator, the fight ensued after Rayudu expressed his displeasure at Jackson taking time to get ready to face the deliveries. The umpires and players had to intervene to end their fight.

99.title: Nurse killed 5-day old baby by injecting air into his stomach, UK court told
99.article_body: A nurse allegedly killed a five-day-old baby by injecting air into his stomach through a nose tube, a UK court heard. Lucy Letby is accused of murdering seven babies and attempting to murder another ten between June 2015 and June 2016 at Countess of Chester hospital. She also allegedly sent a sympathy card to one of her victim's parents.

100.title: Passenger inserts 1066-g gold in rectum, arrested at Kochi airport
100.article_body: Air Intelligence Unit intercepted a passenger at Kerala's Kochi airport on Wednesday for allegedly trying to smuggle gold. The man had inserted four capsule-shaped packets containing 1066.75 g of gold into his rectum. He had travelled on an IndiGo flight from Doha in Qatar. This comes on the same day officials seized 3.8 kg of smuggled gold at Calicut airport.

101.title: Ayodhya verdict doesn't cover Places of Worship Act: SG tells SC
101.article_body: Solicitor General Tushar Mehta told the Supreme Court that the 2019 Ayodhya case verdict given by a five-judge Constitution bench does not deal with the validity of the Places of Worship Act, 1991. The Act protects character of religious places as it was on August 15, 1947. Petitions have been filed against the Act, calling the cut-off date "arbitrary".

102.title: Outsiders should not be allowed to cast their vote in J&K: Azad
102.article_body: Former Jammu and Kashmir CM Ghulam Nabi Azad on Wednesday said that outsiders should not be allowed to cast their vote in the Union Territory. "The importance of voting in Jammu and Kashmir has been that only locals vote," Azad said. His comment comes after administration's order facilitating people residing for over one year in Jammu to register as voters.

103.title: NHAI's InvIT raises funds to finance 3 additional road projects
103.article_body: National Highways Infra Trust has raised ₹1,430 crore through the placement of its units for part funding its acquisition of three additional road projects from NHAI. According to official statement, investors include Canada Pension Plan Investment Board, SBI and TATA AIG, among other investors. Units were subscribed at a premium of ₹109 over the floor price of ₹107.12.

104.title: India's national record-holding discus thrower Kamalpreet banned for 3 years for doping
104.article_body: Kamalpreet Kaur, who holds national record in women's discus throw, has been banned for three years for doping. The Athletics Integrity Unit stated that Kaur tested positive for a banned substance [stanozolol] in a test conducted on March 7 this year. Her period of ineligibility started from March 29 and all her results since March 7 stand null and void.

105.title: Ben Stokes' flying effort at boundary rope to save six goes viral
105.article_body: A video has gone viral showing England all-rounder Ben Stokes' acrobatic effort to save a shot from Australia's Mitchell Marsh from going for a six at long-off during the second T20I in Canberra. Reacting to the video, a fan tweeted, "How he did that so brilliantly!" Another fan wrote, "Unbelievable athleticism!" "His reaction time is outstanding," another tweet read.

106.title: Ola, Uber and Rapido-run autos continue services despite ban in Karnataka
106.article_body: Online booking of auto-rickshaw services continued to be available on ride-hailing platforms such as Uber, Ola and Rapido, despite Karnataka government making such services illegal from Wednesday. However, the number of auto-rickshaws using these platforms seemed to have come down as the waiting time in some places in Bengaluru went up. The move came following multiple complaints of overcharging.

107.title: Shah to inaugurate 'Gujarat Gaurav Yatra' in Ahmedabad on Thursday
107.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah will inaugurate the 'Gujarat Gaurav Yatra' in Ahmedabad on Thursday. Shah is scheduled to visit Sant Shree Savaiyanath temple to pay obeisance in Ahmedabad's Zanzarka and later visit Unai Mata Temple to offer prayers in Navsari district's Unai on Thursday. Earlier on Wednesday, BJP chief JP Nadda flagged off the yatra in Mahesana.

108.title: Thirdhand smoke can trigger skin diseases: Study
108.article_body: Thirdhand smoke, which consists of dust particles from tobacco smoke that remain on surfaces, may trigger skin diseases. According to the study, acute exposure to these particles called THS elevates levels of molecules in the body linked to diseases like contact dermatitis and psoriasis. It may also lead to other diseases, such as cancer, heart disease, and atherosclerosis, researchers said.

109.title: ₹3 cr unaccounted cash seized in Rajasthan's Sirohi, 4 arrested
109.article_body: Four persons travelling in two cars with over ₹3 crore unaccounted cash were detained in Rajasthan's Sirohi district on Wednesday, police said. The cash was recovered from the cars coming from Ahmedabad, Sirohi SP Mamta Gupta confirmed. The police found bundles of notes wrapped in paper under the seats of the two cars at Maval post, DSP Yogesh Sharma said.

110.title: 'Squid Game' actor Anupam Tripathi meets Anurag Kashyap, shares pic
110.article_body: Actor Anupam Tripathi, who played the role of Ali in the South Korean series 'Squid Game', shared a picture with filmmaker Anurag Kashyap on Instagram. "Simply an amazing moment for me. I just had a meeting with one of my favourite film directors from India," Anupam wrote along with the picture. He thanked Anurag for the "short and awesome meeting".

111.title: Swing breaks down at school in UP, 1 child dead & another injured
111.article_body: One child died and another was injured after a swing broke down at a private school in Uttar Pradesh's Bahraich. The injured student was referred to Lucknow. The family member of one of the children said, "We weren't even told what happened to [them]. We came to know that they were taken to district hospital when we came to school."

112.title: LIC sells over 2% stake in Power Grid for ₹3,079 crore in 5 months
112.article_body: Life Insurance Corporation of India (LIC) has sold over 2% of its holding in Power Grid Corporation over the past five months for ₹3,079.43 crore. "Corporation's shareholding in Power Grid...has diluted from 36,99,02,170 to 23,01,82,028 equity shares decreasing its shareholding from 5.303% to 3.3% of the paid-up capital of the said company," LIC said.

113.title: PVR receives shareholders approval for merger with INOX Leisure
113.article_body: Multiplex operator PVR said that it has received approval from its shareholders for the proposed merger with rivals INOX Leisure. PVR convened a meeting of its shareholders on Tuesday, following the directions of the Mumbai bench of the National Company Law Tribunal (NCLT). The proposal was passed by over 99% of the number of valid votes cast.

114.title: India extends validity for sugar exports to US under quota till December 31
114.article_body: Directorate General of Foreign Trade (DGFT) said that the deadline to export raw sugar to the US under Tariff-Rate Quota (TRQ) has been extended till December 31. TRQ is the quota to export products to the US at relatively low tariffs. Total sugar exports to the US under TRQ would be around 10,475 tonnes during 2022, DGFT said in May.

115.title: Ukraine makes 'romantic' appeal to France for more weapons, shares video
115.article_body: Ukraine's Defence Ministry on Wednesday made a "romantic" appeal to France, urging the country to send more artillery to Ukraine amid Russian invasion. "Romantic gestures take many forms...But if you really want to win our hearts...nothing beats 155-mm highly mobile self-propelled artillery," the text in a video clip shared by the ministry read. France recently promised more arms to Ukraine.

116.title: Nehru delayed Kashmir's accession to India: Law Minister to Congress
116.article_body: Law Minister Kiren Rijiju on Wednesday said Jawaharlal Nehru delayed Kashmir's accession to India and the country is still paying the price for the ex-PM's follies. He was reacting to Congress' claim that Maharaja Hari Singh dithered on the question of accession. Rijiju claimed Singh had approached Nehru for accession to India in July 1947, but Nehru rejected his request.

117.title: RBI asks entities to stop taking ratings from Brickwork Ratings
117.article_body: The Reserve Bank of India has asked entities and market participants to stop taking fresh ratings and credit evaluations from Brickwork Ratings India Private Limited. On October 6, SEBI asked the credit rating agency to wind down operations and cancelled its Certificate of Registration (CoR). The instructions regarding existing ratings issued by Brickwork shall be advised separately, RBI said.

118.title: India's projected debt ratio to be 84% of GDP: IMF
118.article_body: Paolo Mauro, Deputy Director, Fiscal Affairs Department, International Monetary Fund, said India's debt ratio is projected to be 84% of its GDP by the end of 2022. Mauro stressed that it is important for India to have a very clear medium-term objective on the fiscal. "It would be very important to give reassurance that things are under control," he added.

119.title: Punjab govt allows green crackers from 8 pm to 10 pm on Diwali
119.article_body: Punjab Minister Gurmeet Singh Meet Hayer on Wednesday said only green crackers will be allowed for two hours from 8 pm on Diwali. He added crackers will be permitted from 4 am to 5 am and from 9 pm to 10 pm on 'Gurpurab'. They will be allowed from 11.55 pm to 12.30 am on Christmas and New Year.

120.title: Pak PM Shehbaz Sharif, son acquitted in PKR 16-billion money laundering case
120.article_body: Pakistan PM Shehbaz Sharif and his son Hamza were acquitted by a special court of the Federal Investigation Agency (FIA) in a money laundering case on Wednesday. The FIA had booked Sharif and his sons for allegedly committing over PKR 16 billion in money laundering in 2020. "Another fabricated case created for political victimisation comes to its...end," the PML-N tweeted.

121.title: Govt scraps privatisation of Bhadravati steel plant on low bidder interest
121.article_body: The Department of Investment and Public Asset Management (DIPAM) said the privatisation of SAIL’s Bhadravati steel plant has been scrapped due to low bidder interest. The transaction was annulled with the approval of Alternative Mechanism (Empowered Group of Ministers). DIPAM said multiple Expressions of Interest (EoIs) had been received and qualified bidders had conducted due diligence.

122.title: Salman Khan whitewashing his toxic masculinity: Sona on #MeToo accused Sajid
122.article_body: Speaking about Sajid Khan's participation in 'Bigg Boss 16', singer Sona Mohapatra tweeted that the show's host and actor Salman Khan is whitewashing his own toxic masculinity. "Continues the whitewashing in the BRO-HOOD...(Btw his gifting watches/food truck/surgeries is only more virtue signalling)," she added. Several women accused Sajid of sexual misconduct during the #MeToo movement in 2018.

123.title: Secret ballot for Cong Prez polls to ensure level playing field: CEA Mistry
123.article_body: The Presidential polls for the Congress party will have a secret ballot to ensure a level playing field for both Mallikarjun Kharge and Shashi Tharoor, the party's Central Election Authority Chairman Madhusudan Mistry said. Mistry further added that the polling authority cannot stop any individual from campaigning. The ballot papers will be mixed before counting starts, Mistry added.

124.title: India's factory output in August contracts for the first time in 18 months
124.article_body: India's Index of Industrial Production contracted 0.8% year-on-year in August for the first time in 18 months, according to government data released on Wednesday. Month-on-month, the index declined 2.3% compared with a decline of 2.9% in July. Mining output fell 3.9%, while manufacturing activity fell by 0.7%, indicating a broader slowdown in the country.

125.title: Mohammad Shami confirms he is going to Australia ahead of T20 WC, shares pics from flight
125.article_body: Pacer Mohammad Shami on Wednesday confirmed that he is going to Australia ahead of the T20 World Cup 2022. Sharing pictures from a flight on Instagram, the 32-year-old pacer wrote, "Time to fly now for T20 World Cup." Shami is reportedly in contention to replace the vacant spot left by injured Jasprit Bumrah in India's T20 World Cup 2022 squad.

126.title: Adda247 raises $35 million led by WestBridge Capital, Google and Info Edge
126.article_body: Ed-tech platform ﻿Adda247 announced raising $35 million in a round led by WestBridge Capital. The round also saw participation from Google as a new investor and existing investors, Info Edge and Asha Impact. The company said the funds will be used to enhance its tech and product profile, expand its student counselling team, and hiring for some key leadership roles.

127.title: HCL Tech net profit increases 7% to ₹3,489 crore in Q2
127.article_body: IT major HCL Technologies announced that its consolidated net profit saw a 7.05% year-on-year growth, taking it to ₹3,489 crore in the quarter ended September 2022. The company registered a revenue of ₹24,686 crore, clocking a 19.5% growth over ₹20,655 crore last year. Sequentially, revenue rose 5.2% from ₹23,464 crore in quarter ended June 2022.

128.title: Wipro registers ₹2,659 crore net profit in Q2 FY23; sees Y-o-Y decline of 9%
128.article_body: IT services firm Wipro released its Q2 results, reporting consolidated net profit of ₹2,659 crore, which was 9% less than ₹2,930 crore in the same period last year. The company's revenue from operations stood at ₹22,539.7 crore, a 14.60% increase over ₹19,667.4 crore in the previous year. Sequentially, profit rose 3.71% from ₹2563.6 crore in the previous quarter.

129.title: Got nose job to look prettier, it's my face, why wouldn't I: Shruti
129.article_body: Actress Shruti Haasan said it is very obvious that she got her nose fixed as she did her first film with her "old nose". "My nose was broken...And people are like she's just using the deviated septum excuse," she said. "I did have a deviated septum...But if I could make it prettier, it's my face, why wouldn't I?" Shruti added.

130.title: Fireside Ventures raises $225 million for third fund
130.article_body: Fireside Ventures﻿ announced that it has raised third fund at $225 million (₹1,830 crore), which is the largest capital raised yet by the five-year-old firm. The early-stage investor said the new fund would invest in about 25-30 Indian startups focusing on the health and wellness, lifestyle and consumer goods categories. Investors include SBI, ITC and Premji Invest, among other firms.

131.title: ICC names 5 changes to playing conditions to keep an eye on during T20 World Cup
131.article_body: ICC named five changes to playing conditions to keep an eye on during T20 World Cup 2022. They include five-run penalty for unfair movement by fielding side, new batter to take strike after caught dismissals, in-match over penalty for slow over-rate, batters requiring to have some part of their bat/body within pitch and 'mankading', which is no longer 'unfair play'.

132.title: American Idol fame Willie shared video of him singing in car on Insta hours before death
132.article_body: Singer Willie Spence, who passed away in a car accident aged 23, had shared a video of himself singing inside a car hours before his accident. "Lord you are my hiding place," he had captioned the video. Reacting to his post, singer Katharine McPhee Foster wrote, "You're with Jesus now. God bless you. Thankful for the time we had."

133.title: Shouldn't boycott film when govt is doing best to better economy: Rakul
133.article_body: Actress Rakul Preet Singh said the film industry suffers when a film gets boycotted. She added there's a chain reaction that follows after a film gets boycotted. "Employment goes down. At a time when the government is doing its best to better the economy, we shouldn't advocate these things," she added. Recently, several films faced 'boycott' calls on social media.

134.title: 25 lakh people affected due to floods after incessant rains in UP
134.article_body: Around 25 lakh people from 2,000 villages in Uttar Pradesh's 15 districts are affected due to floods after incessant rainfall in the state. The discharge from Nepal dams has resulted in the swelling of the Ramganga river in the Bareilly district. CM Yogi Adityanath made an aerial survey of flood-affected areas in the Balrampur, Shravasti and Gonda districts.

135.title: Mercedes-Benz, Microsoft collaborate to improve auto production
135.article_body: Mercedes-Benz and Microsoft have collaborated to use Microsoft Cloud for a data platform to improve production efficiency at auto plants around the world. According to a statement, the data platform is called MO360, and is presently available in Europe, the Middle East and Africa. The collaboration is aiming for a 20% increase in vehicle production efficiency by 2025.

136.title: Broccoli gas can help in finding life on other planets: Scientists
136.article_body: Scientists believe broccoli gas could help provide compelling evidence of life on other planets. In order to expel toxins, broccoli, like other organisms, adds one carbon and three hydrogen atoms to an unwanted chemical and turns the potential toxin into a gas that floats away into atmosphere safely. Detection of such gases on other planets may hint at alien life.

137.title: Delhi govt defying RTI Act fearing corruption exposure: BJP
137.article_body: The BJP has accused the AAP-led Delhi government for defying the RTI Act fearing exposure of its corrupt practices. BJP spokesperson Gaurav Bhatia claimed that various departments such as education, health, transport or excise are marred by corrupt practices. Bhatia further said that the Delhi government has been running away from transparency and accountability.

138.title: ED raids premises of officials in Chhattisgarh; seizes ₹4 cr in cash
138.article_body: The Enforcement Directorate raided several premises in Chhattisgarh and recovered ₹4 crore in cash along with jewellery, in connection with a money laundering case. Reportedly, the raids were conducted at the premises of district collector, some senior officials, businessmen, and politicians of the ruling party. CM Bhupesh Baghel called the raids an "act of intimidation".

139.title: Reports of UGC-NET History paper leak are fake: NTA
139.article_body: The National Testing Agency (NTA) on Wednesday issued a statement saying that a fake tweet and YouTube video are circulating on social media regarding the leak of the History paper during the UGC-NET December 2021 and June 2022 (merged cycles) examination. The NTA denied the allegations. The exam was conducted on October 10.

140.title: HCLTech adds highest-ever 10,339 freshers, reports 23.8% attrition in Jul-Sept
140.article_body: HCLTech reported its highest-ever hiring of 10,339 freshers in July-September quarter, MD and CEO C Vijayakumar said on Wednesday. HCLTech's attrition rate in the quarter stood at 23.8%, same as that in April-June quarter. Meanwhile, the firm reported net employee addition of 8,359 employees in Q2 FY23, up from net employee addition of 2,089 employees in Q1 FY23.

141.title: Shivakumar wears T-shirt highlighting unemployment at Bharat Jodo Yatra
141.article_body: Karnataka Congress chief DK Shivakumar wore a T-shirt highlighting the issue of unemployment during the Bharat Jodo Yatra on Wednesday. Sharing an image of himself wearing the T-shirt, he tweeted, "Youth of Karnataka need jobs, not empty promises." He accused the BJP of making "hollow promises" regarding employment. Notably, Congress MP Rahul Gandhi met around 2,000 unemployed people on Wednesday.

142.title: Wipro to give 100% variable pay to 85% of employees in Q2 FY23: CEO
142.article_body: IT services firm Wipro's CEO Thierry Delaporte has said that the company will pay out 100% of variable pay to 85% of its employees for the second quarter. The remaining 15% of the employees will reportedly get their variable pay as per policy. The company's net profit fell 9.27% YoY to ₹2,659 crore in Q2 FY22.

143.title: BJP is the only national party left in India: Party chief JP Nadda
143.article_body: While addressing a gathering in Gujarat, BJP President JP Nadda said his party is the only national party left in India. Calling Congress "a party of a brother and sister", he claimed Congress leaders are only in the party for merriment and to serve a family. He said parties likes SP, TRS, TMC and RJD are carrying out dynasty politics.

144.title: Rupee drops 14 paise to close at 82.35 against US dollar
144.article_body: The Indian rupee declined by 14 paise to close at 82.35 against the US dollar on Wednesday. At the interbank foreign exchange market, the local currency opened at 82.32 and witnessed an intra-day high of 82.15 and a low of 82.37 against the American currency. The rupee touched a new record low of 82.67 against the US dollar on Monday.

145.title: SP leader writes to Prez, demands 'Bharat Ratna' for Mulayam Singh Yadav
145.article_body: In a letter to President Droupadi Murmu, SP leader IP Singh demanded that late SP founder and former UP CM Mulayam Singh Yadav be conferred with the 'Bharat Ratna'. In a separate letter to UP CM Yogi Adityanath, Singh requested him to rename the Agra-Lucknow Expressway as the 'Dhartiputra Mulayam Singh Yadav' Expressway. Yadav passed away on Monday, aged 82.

146.title: Ready to fight legal battle to give justice to SCs & STs: K'taka CM
146.article_body: Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai on Wednesday said that his government would do everything to give justice to the Scheduled Castes and Scheduled Tribes in the state. "We're ready to fight a legal battle to give justice to...SC/ST," Bommai said. Days after taking a decision to grant more reservations to the SCs/STs, Bommai accused Congress of trying to mislead the public.

147.title: How does the final medal tally of 36th National Games read?
147.article_body: The 36th National Games came to a conclusion on Wednesday, with Services Sports Control Board (SSCB) finishing on top of the medal tally with 61 gold medals. Maharashtra came second with 39 gold medals, while Haryana came third with 38 gold medals. Overall, Maharashtra won the most number of medals with 140, while SSCB won 128.

148.title: Loved Prashanth's work in 'KGF', he creates special world: Shruti Haasan
148.article_body: Actress Shruti Haasan praised filmmaker Prashanth Neel for his work in the 'KGF' franchise. "I loved Prashanth sir's work in KGF and I think he really creates a special world that you get a grand feeling as an audience and actor," she added. Shruti will feature in Prashanth's 'Salaar', which also features 'Baahubali' actor Prabhas.

149.title: 200 tourists stranded due to heavy rains, landslides in Sikkim
149.article_body: Heavy rains and resultant landslides in Sikkim have left 200 tourists stranded and have also affected piped water supply to the state capital Gangtok, officials said on Wednesday. The rains are set to continue and the India Meteorological Department has issued a red alert in the state. There were reports of heavy rains in neighbouring north Bengal and Bhutan too.

150.title: OPEC cuts 2022 oil demand growth for 4th time amid rising inflation
150.article_body: Organization of the Petroleum Exporting Countries (OPEC) cut its 2022 forecast for growth in world oil demand for the fourth time since April. OPEC said that oil demand will increase by 2.7% to 2.64 million barrels per day (bpd) in 2022, down 460,000 bpd from its previous forecast. It has also cut oil demand for next year by 3,60,000 bpd.

151.title: Prez Murmu gets all-women guard of honour from Tripura Police, pics surface
151.article_body: President Droupadi Murmu was accorded an all-women "guard of honour" on Wednesday, in a special gesture by the Tripura Police on her arrival in Agartala. President Murmu interacted with women tea workers of the Durgabari Tea Estate. "Are you getting free rice and benefits of other government schemes?" she asked one of the five-six female workers with whom she interacted.

152.title: Prez Droupadi Murmu interacts with women tea workers in Tripura
152.article_body: President Droupadi Murmu interacted with women tea workers of Durgabari Tea Estate in Agartala on Wednesday. "They represent the state's social diversity and seem satisfied with welfare initiatives for them," the President said in a tweet. She urged them to focus on education of their children, particularly girls. The President also laid the foundation stone of Tripura's National Law University.

153.title: Shah Rukh Khan books 5-star hotel rooms for fans, meets them individually; pics surface
153.article_body: Actor Shah Rukh Khan recently booked 5-star hotel rooms for some of his fans and met them individually after finishing his shoot schedule for 'Jawan' in Chennai. "A manager along with two butlers were allotted to us," a fan said. "He gave us all enough time to interact, click pictures and even present him with our gifts," the fan added.

154.title: Video games could trigger heart attack in kids with cardiac problems: Study
154.article_body: According to a study, playing video games can trigger heart attacks in kids with underlying cardiac problems. Some kids are born with cardiac arrhythmia, an abnormal heartbeat, which remains untreated until a scan reveals it. The excitement, adrenaline, and emotional investment while playing video games can cause a flare-up leading to loss of consciousness, cardiac arrest, and even death.

155.title: It's definitely gonna blow up: Shekhar on music of SRK's 'Pathaan'
155.article_body: Music composer Shekhar Ravjiani took to Twitter and shared a picture of himself from the music studio. Along with his picture, he wrote, "Back to the musicverse of 'Pathaan' and the electrifying power of Shah Rukh Khan." He added, "It's definitely gonna blow up! It's positively going to get you off the floor! Need I say more?"

156.title: Indian, US oil and gas companies sign 4 MoUs for clean energy partnership
156.article_body: Indian and American gas and oil companies signed four major MoUs to strengthen the bilateral strategic clean energy partnership. The MoUs were signed by the Minister of Petroleum and Natural Gas Hardeep Singh Puri during a round table in Houston. Indian Oil, Aavantika Gas Limited, Engineers India Limited and Indraprastha Gas Limited were the companies to sign the MoU.

157.title: Google Pixel 6a, Pixel 7 to soon get 5G update in India
157.article_body: Google Pixel 6a and Pixel 7 smartphones will soon be getting a new update to enable their users to connect to the 5G network in India. Google has confirmed that it is working with Indian telecom operators to allow 5G functionality. Meanwhile, Samsung on Wednesday confirmed that it will enable 5G support on its Galaxy devices in India by mid-November.

158.title: Campaign to be conducted against tobacco & gutkha soon: MP Minister
158.article_body: Madhya Pradesh Home Minister Narottam Mishra said a campaign will be conducted against tobacco and gutkha soon in the state. Mishra also said that all hookah lounges have been closed across Madhya Pradesh. Over 43,000 litres of liquor have been seized and 360 cases have been registered under the NDPS Act, Mishra said, adding drug traders will not be spared.

159.title: India's geospatial economy to cross ₹63,000 crore by 2025: Minister
159.article_body: Union Minister Jitendra Singh on Tuesday said that India's geospatial economy is expected to cross ₹63,000 crore by 2025 at a growth rate of 12.8%. He further said it will provide employment to more than 10 lakh people mainly through geospatial startups. He said this while addressing the Second United Nations World Geospatial Information Congress (UN-WGIC) 2022 in Hyderabad.

160.title: Register with education dept soon or shut down: U'khand govt to madrassas
160.article_body: Madrassas across Uttarakhand have been asked to register with the state education department within one month or face closure. "Not registering with the state education department is harming the future of the students who study [in those madrassas] as they face problems in getting admissions after class 5," a state minister said. There are around 400 unregistered madrassas in Uttarakhand.

161.title: Indian energy firms come together to develop carbon market
161.article_body: An alliance of key stakeholders in the carbon markets, the Carbon Markets Association of India (CMAI), has been formed to develop a carbon credit market to achieve energy transition goals. CMAI President Manish Dabkara said CMAI would act as a mediator between government and industries. The association includes Gautam Adani's Adani Group and Dabkara's EKI Energy Services, among other firms.

162.title: American Idol runner-up Willie Spence dies in car accident aged 23
162.article_body: Singer Willie Spence, who finished runner-up in 19th season of American Idol, passed away in a car accident aged 23. Willie was in Tennessee at the time of the accident. "Life's so unfair and nothing is ever promised...God rest your soul Willie. It was a pleasure to sing with you and to know you," singer Katharine McPhee wrote on Instagram.

163.title: FIR against ex-UP minister's aide for allegedly molesting Dalit woman
163.article_body: A case has been registered against former Uttar Pradesh Minister Swami Prasad Maurya's personal secretary and 12 others for allegedly molesting a Dalit woman and trying to kill her brothers in Lucknow. The woman has alleged that they passed casteist remarks and threatened to outrage her modesty. She added she complained about it to Maurya but he didn't take action.

164.title: Retail inflation averages at 7.02% in Jul-Sept, down from 7.28% in Apr-Jun
164.article_body: Retail inflation in India averaged at 7.02% in the July-September 2022 quarter, down from the 7.28% average inflation recorded in the April-June 2022 quarter, data from the Statistics Ministry released on Wednesday showed. Average inflation was at 6.34% in the January-March quarter of this year. Retail inflation was at 7.41% in September, up from 7% in August.

165.title: Olympic medallist Sushil Kumar to face trial for murder in 23-yr-old wrestler's death
165.article_body: Two-time Olympic medal-winning wrestler Sushil Kumar will face trial for murder in the death of 23-year-old wrestler Sagar Dhankar. A Delhi court today framed charges relating to murder, attempt to murder, rioting, unlawful assembly, and other sections, including criminal conspiracy, against Sushil and 17 others in the case. The court also framed charges against two accused who are absconding.

166.title: No citizen can be prosecuted under annulled section 66A of IT Act: SC
166.article_body: The Supreme Court on Wednesday said that no citizen can be prosecuted under the annulled section 66A of the IT Act. Under section 66A, a person posting offensive content could be sentenced to up to three years in jail and also be fined. The apex court also directed authorities to not register any cases deemed to allegedly violate 66A.

167.title: Vicky & I get less time together, we've been away on shoots: Katrina
167.article_body: Actress Katrina Kaif, speaking about her husband and actor Vicky Kaushal, has said that they get less time together. "He has been away a lot on shoots, as have I," the actress added. However, Katrina has said that Vicky is a wonderful person. "I think it's nice to have a person like that in my life," she further added.

168.title: Policing virtual world like shutting down speakeasies: Roblox Chief Scientist
168.article_body: Policing the virtual world is like "shutting down speakeasies", said Roblox Chief Scientist Morgan McGuire referring to US prohibition-era bars hiding from law enforcement. The firm is deploying bots to detect any dangerous content that players may have disguised. Users had reportedly created explicit private spaces, known as "condos", where people's digital avatars could engage in virtual sex.

169.title: 11 lakh railway employees to get 78 days' wages as productivity bonus
169.article_body: Union Minister Anurag Thakur on Wednesday announced that the Centre has approved a productivity-linked bonus equivalent to the wage of 78 days for eligible non-gazetted railway employees. This will benefit more than 11 lakh non-gazetted railway employees and it will cost the government approximately ₹1,832 crore. The maximum amount payable per eligible railway employee is ₹17,951 for 78 days.

170.title: Human sacrifice-accused wasn't party worker, likely influenced by wife: CPI(M)
170.article_body: The CPI(M) on Wednesday said that one of the accused, Bhagaval Singh, in the Kerala human sacrifice case wasn't a party worker. "[Singh changed] after his second marriage, he became...religious...It might be the influence of his wife," a party leader said. Three people have been sent to 14-day judicial custody over the mutilation and murder of two women in Pathanamthitta.

171.title: MobiKwik raises more debt, changes ESOP policy: Report
171.article_body: MobiKwik has raised total debt of ₹55 crore since August from BlackSoil and Alternative Investment Fund, Karnation, according to two Registrar of Companies filings. MobiKwik's board passed a resolution for allotment of 900 non-convertible debentures, in tranches of 700 and 200, to raise ₹35 crore and ₹10 crore from BlackSoil. MobiKwik has also reportedly made changes to its ESOP policy.

172.title: Haridwar on alert as dengue cases rise, 173 cases reported so far
172.article_body: Haridwar has been witnessing a rise in dengue cases with 173 infections being reported so far, said District Malaria Officer Gurnam Singh. "ASHA workers are conducting insecticide spraying inside residential buildings," Singh said, adding all agencies are working together for dengue prevention. "Anti-larvae spray and fogging being done in open areas with standing water," a civic official said.

173.title: CCTV footage shows 32-year-old businessman being shot dead in Delhi
173.article_body: A 32-year old businessman identified as Mohit Arora was allegedly shot dead in Delhi's Uttam Nagar area.
