According to reports, the alleged incident took place on Monday, when Arora's elder brother was riding the scooter and the deceased was sitting pillion. In a CCTV footage, the assailants can be seen shooting Arora dead and escaping from the scene.

174.title: Couldn't finish watching 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2', it was scary: Katrina
174.article_body: Actress Katrina Kaif has said that she couldn't finish watching Kartik Aaryan-starrer 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2'. Explaining the reason behind it, the 'Phone Bhoot' actress said, "I had to like cover my eyes. When Tabu comes all that even though I know that there is humour inside of it, even for me that was very very scary."

175.title: 'Teri Mitti' was among toughest songs I've sung, it's powerful: Praak
175.article_body: Singer B Praak has said that 'Teri Mitti' was one of the toughest songs he has sung. "It's a powerful song that tells an incredible story and invokes patriotic fervour. So, to do justice to it was something I was very adamant about," he added. The song featured in Akshay Kumar and Parineeti Chopra's 2019 film 'Kesari'.

176.title: Transgenders walk with Rahul during 'Bharat Jodo Yatra' in K'taka
176.article_body: Members of the transgender community met Congress leader Rahul Gandhi in Karnataka during 'Bharat Jodo Yatra' and shared their stories with him, while highlighting the need for generating employment for them. Gandhi said that the ruling BJP and RSS have always been against the transgender community and agreed that there is a need for equality among all sections of society.

177.title: Radio-collared tiger goes missing from Rajaji Tiger Reserve in U'khand
177.article_body: A radio-collared tiger has gone missing from the Rajaji Tiger Reserve in Uttarakhand nearly two years after being translocated from Corbett Tiger Reserve. It has been more than two weeks since the tiger went missing, Chief Wildlife Warden Samir Sinha said. It's possible that the tiger either dropped its radio collar or battery of the device ran out, Sinha added.

178.title: 'I'll come back': Shiv Sena's Sanjay Raut writes to mother from jail
178.article_body: Shiv Sena MP Sanjay Raut, who is in judicial custody in Patra Chawl land scam case, has written a letter to his mother. "Mother, I will definitely come back. The soul of Maharashtra and our country cannot be killed so easily," he wrote. Raut added, "Don't worry though, Uddhav Thackeray and Shiv Sainiks will take care of you."

179.title: Amitabh Bachchan is still naughty & sometimes grumpy on sets: Hema Malini
179.article_body: Actress Hema Malini said that veteran actor Amitabh Bachchan was "very quiet" when they worked together for the first time. Hema and Amitabh worked together in several films like 'Sholay' and 'Baghban'. She stated that Amitabh hasn't changed at all. "He's still very naughty, mischievous...sometimes serious and grumpy. He changes the mood on the sets with his entry," she added.

180.title: Class 7 Odisha boy immolates self as parents don't allow him to stay back longer
180.article_body: A 12-year-old boy, who had come home on holiday from his boarding school, reportedly immolated himself after his parents didn't allow him to stay back longer in Odisha's Cuttack. The class 7 boy's mother said he was unwilling to return to the boarding school after the Durga Puja vacation. He has been hospitalised and is reportedly in a serious condition.

181.title: Rape-accused police officer in Hyd dismissed without inquiry
181.article_body: Inspector K Nageswara Rao of Marredpally police station in Hyderabad, who was allegedly accused of kidnapping and sexually assaulting a woman at gunpoint, was dismissed without any inquiry, as per a police statement. The statement added that there wouldn't be an atmosphere to conduct a free and fair inquiry. Rao was suspended, arrested, and remanded to judicial custody.

182.title: Construction of mosques at Hyd Secretariat nearly completed: Wakf Board
182.article_body: The Telangana Wakf Board told the High Court that the construction of two mosques razed at the Secretariat in Hyderabad is almost completed. The state government informed the court that the construction of the temple is half-completed and soon will be ready for performing prayers. When the old Secretariat was razed, three religious places were also razed with them.

183.title: Byju's to lay off around 2,500 employees
183.article_body: World's most valued edtech startup Byju's said it'll lay off around 2,500 employees. "To avoid redundancies and duplication of roles, and by leveraging technology better, around 5% of BYJU'S 50,000-strong workforce is expected to be rationalised across product, content, media, and technology teams in phased manner," the company said. Byju's had laid off hundreds of employees in June as well.

184.title: TN govt notifies India's first Slender Loris sanctuary in Karur & Dindigul
184.article_body: The Tamil Nadu government on Wednesday notified the country's first Slender Loris sanctuary covering an area of 11,806 hectares in the state's Karur and Dindigul districts. "The sanctuary [is]...yet another milestone in Tamil Nadu's conservation efforts," said CM MK Stalin. Slender Loris is a biological predator of pests in agricultural crops and benefits farmers.

185.title: Rachakonda Police inaugurate CCTV camera network at Keesara
185.article_body: Hyderabad's Rachakonda Police along with Nagaram Municipal Council installed 116 closed circuit cameras in Keesara. Telangana Minister for Labour and Employment Chamakura Malla Reddy inaugurated the cameras on Wednesday. Installing surveillance cameras would provide round-the-clock security to the citizens, Reddy said. Rachakonda Commissionerate has a lakh surveillance cameras installed, he added.

186.title: Kejriwal used Punjab Police for political ambitions: Tajinder Bagga
186.article_body: Soon after Punjab and Haryana HC quashed an FIR registered against him, Delhi BJP leader Tajinder Pal Singh Bagga said that Delhi CM asked the Punjab Police to register a false case against him. "The Punjab Police were used by Kejriwal for his personal political ambitions," he alleged, adding that Kejriwal has defamed them.

187.title: Flying, sale of sky lanterns prohibited in Mumbai for 30 days
187.article_body: Mumbai Police have prohibited flying, sale and storage of sky lanterns ahead of Diwali. The prohibitory order is applicable for 30 days (October 16-November 14) in Mumbai Police Commissionerate area. Any person contravening this order shall be punishable under Section 188 of the Indian Penal Code. A police official said the use of lanterns may cause danger to human life.

188.title: K'taka CM having breakfast at Dalit's house is 'photo-op': Cong
188.article_body: Congress on Wednesday criticised Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai for having breakfast at a Dalit's house, saying that he did it as a "photo-op" for votes ahead of the Assembly elections in the state next year. The government has done nothing for the welfare of Dalits but is now remembering SCs and STs as elections are approaching, said Congress leader Siddaramaiah.

189.title: Can't you become bhaijaan to wronged women: Sherlyn to Salman on Sajid joining Bigg Boss
189.article_body: Sherlyn Chopra, who had accused filmmaker Sajid Khan of sexual misconduct, has questioned Salman Khan for having the #MeToo accused on 'Bigg Boss 16'. "The message that's going out...is that it's okay to molest a woman," she said. "I don't understand what has happened to Salman Khan....You call yourself...bhaijaan, can't you become bhaijaan to us wronged women?" Sherlyn added.

190.title: Retail inflation rises to a 5-month high of 7.41% in September
190.article_body: The country’s retail inflation, which is measured by the Consumer Price Index (CPI), rose to a five-month high of 7.41% in the month of September, government data showed. The CPI stood at 7% in August, 6.71% in July, 7.01% in June and 7.04% in May. In April, the CPI had hit an eight-year-high of 7.79%.

191.title: Chennai man stabs wife for uploading duet videos with other men on social media
191.article_body: A 20-year-old man reportedly stabbed his wife with a knife for uploading duet videos with other men on social media. According to police, the couple used to fight regularly as the woman uploaded videos of her performing songs with strangers. On Monday night, the accused reportedly went home drunk and picked up a fight with his wife and stabbed her.

192.title: New Vande Bharat train to cut Chandigarh-Delhi route to less than 3 hrs
192.article_body: India's fourth Vande Bharat Express, which PM Narendra Modi will flag off on Thursday, will reduce the travel time from Chandigarh to Delhi to less than three hours. The train will have advanced state-of-the-art safety features for commuters travelling from Una to Delhi. The train will boast reclining seats as well as an automatic fire sensor, reports said.

193.title: People felt I was talking about my depression to promote a film: Deepika
193.article_body: Deepika Padukone, in a conversation with Meghan Markle, revealed many people thought she was either promoting a film or was being paid by a pharmaceutical company when she opened up about her depression. "They thought I was being paid by a pharmaceutical company and you know that I'm now going to start advertising for some sort of medication," she added.

194.title: 2 groups fight over seats in Sinhagad Express train; video surfaces
194.article_body: A fight over seats reportedly broke out between two groups travelling on the Sinhagad Express train. A video of the incident where passengers are seen pushing and pulling each other has gone viral on social media. The video also shows some people trying to solve the matter. The fight reportedly took place between the train's passengers and Chakarmanis (workers).

195.title: PM cries that we've outsourced job of abusing him to AAP wrong: Cong
195.article_body: Congress spokesperson Jairam Ramesh on Wednesday said, "PM [Narendra Modi] cries that Congress has outsourced 'abusing' him to AAP [are] completely wrong!" "We only point out the litany of falsehoods that flow from the PM's mouth, every time he opens it," he added. This comes a day after PM Modi said that Congress has "outsourced" the contract of abusing him.

196.title: 25% of shops surveyed on Oct 10 lacked Marathi signboards: BMC
196.article_body: The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) officials on Monday visited 2,158 shops across Mumbai to see if they had put up Marathi signboards and found that 1,636 or 75% had complied. "There were 522 shops which didn't display Marathi boards. We have issued notices to them," a BMC official said. The third deadline for implementing Marathi signboards ended on September 30.

197.title: 191 drones entered India from Pak in 9 months, 7 shot down: Report
197.article_body: Security forces have observed the illegal entry of 191 drones into Indian territory from Pakistan in the past nine months, ANI reported after accessing an official document. While 171 drones had entered into Indian territory through the India-Pakistan border along the Punjab sector, 20 were spotted in the Jammu sector, the report added. BSF personnel reportedly shot down seven drones.

198.title: Cong must decentralise authority: Tharoor ahead of party's chief poll
198.article_body: Congress Presidential poll candidate Shashi Tharoor on Wednesday said that the party must decentralise authority and truly empower the grassroots office-bearers of the party. "If elected as Congress chief, important first step will be to call for polls to CWC to spread inner-party democracy further," Tharoor added. The Congress Presidential poll will be held on October 17.

199.title: Wipro's net employee addition falls to 605, attrition down to 23% in Jul-Sept
199.article_body: IT services firm Wipro on Wednesday said its net employee addition during the July-September 2022 quarter was 605 people, down from 15,446 employees it hired in the April-June 2022 quarter. Wipro's attrition rate for Q2 FY23 was 23%, down from 23.3% recorded in Q1 FY23. Wipro was the only IT major to report a fall in attrition in last quarter.

200.title: Bangalore University students call off protest on ministers' assurance
200.article_body: The students of Bangalore University's Jnana Bharathi campus have called off their protest which started after a BMTC bus ran over a 23-year-old post-graduate student on Monday. The students demanded a ban on the movement of public vehicles inside the campus. They stopped the protest after Karnataka ministers assured them that the issue will be discussed with CM Basavaraj Bommai.

201.title: Told Big B 'Marry me, I'm in love with you' when I was 10: Swetha Menon
201.article_body: Malayalam actress Swetha Menon recalled an incident when she proposed to veteran actor Amitabh Bachchan when she was a 10-year-old girl. She said Amitabh had come to Allahabad to immerse the ashes of ex-Prime Minister Indira Gandhi. "There was absolute silence...I reached Bachchan and told him to please 'marry me as I am in love with you'," she stated.

202.title: India never believed in expansion, particularly of geographical boundaries: VP
202.article_body: Vice President Jagdeep Dhankhar on Wednesday said any expansion, particularly of geographical boundaries, involves a violation of human rights and that India as a nation never believed in such a policy. In his address at the Foundation Day of NHRC, he said Indian ethos is such that the country's concern is not limited to itself but cares for the world.

203.title: Bombs, claymore mines hidden by Maoists unearthed in Maha forest
203.article_body: Police have unearthed two live pressure cooker bombs and two claymore mines which were hidden in a forest by Maoists in Maharashtra's Gadchiroli district. A pistol, two wire bundles and an aluminium utensil were also recovered. Police had conducted a search operation after receiving an input on Tuesday that Maoists had buried explosives in the area to harm security forces.

204.title: Delhi has received 128.2 mm rain so far this month, highest for Oct in 66 years
204.article_body: Delhi has recorded 128.2 mm rainfall so far this month, the highest for October in 66 years, India Meteorological Department said. Delhi had received 236.2 mm rainfall in October 1956, while the all-time record rainfall for the month, at 238.2 mm, was recorded in 1954. Rainfall recorded this month is the fourth highest rainfall ever recorded in Delhi in October.

205.title: Hyderabad Police busts ₹900 cr investment fraud racket, 10 arrested
205.article_body: The Hyderabad Cyber Crime Police on Wednesday arrested 10 people, including a Chinese national, for their alleged involvement in a ₹900 crore investment fraud spread across the country. According to a police official, raids were conducted on a few call centres operating from Delhi and other places, following which the network of the fake investment companies was broken.

206.title: Slower ones are not that effective against someone like Kohli: Harshal
206.article_body: India pacer Harshal Patel has said that his slower deliveries are more effective when players go deep in the crease and try to slog. "For someone like Virat Kohli, whenever I've played against him, he steps out and makes it a full toss and plays it through midwicket," added Harshal. Harshal has picked three wickets in his last six T20Is.

207.title: Aaj pehli baar laga bin suraj ke uga savera: Akhilesh after father's funeral
207.article_body: Samajwadi Party chief Akhilesh Yadav shared a tweet a day after his father Mulayam Singh Yadav was cremated with full state honours. "Aaj pehli baar laga…bin suraj ke uga savera (For the first time it felt as if morning arrived without the sun)," Akhilesh Yadav tweeted. He also shared two pictures from the site where the SP founder was cremated.

208.title: Crypto firm Blockchain.com gets Singapore licence a day after Coinbase
208.article_body: Blockchain.com, a cryptocurrency exchange backed by Lightspeed Venture Partners, has said that it has received approval from Singapore's central bank to offer services in the city-state. The announcement comes a day after cryptocurrency exchange company, Coinbase, received the same approval. There are total 18 cryptocurrency exchange firms allowed to operate in Singapore.

209.title: Who knew Modi before 2002 riots: JDU Chief Nitish Kumar
209.article_body: JDU chief Nitish Kumar alleged it was in the light of the Gujarat riots that headlines with the name of Prime Minister Narendra Modi appeared. "Who knew Modi before 2002 riots?" he said. "During the JP movement, I went to jail," he added. The remark came after Amit Shah accused Nitish Kumar of betraying Jayaprakash Narayan and siding with Congress.

210.title: Rahul walks with families of organ donors during Bharat Jodo Yatra in K’taka
210.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi, during the Bharat Jodo Yatra, on Wednesday walked along with the families of people who donated their organs. The yatra resumed from Karnataka's Challakere today morning. "Today, Bharat yatris are joined by families who donated organs of their deceased loved ones. Their selfless gesture is helping raise awareness about this important issue," Congress tweeted.

211.title: 2 Delhi govt schools top EW India School Rankings, 'proud of my team', says CM
211.article_body: Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal on Wednesday congratulated his "Team Education" after two Delhi government schools topped the EducationWorld India School Rankings 2022-23. Rajkiya Pratibha Vikas Vidyalaya in Dwarka's Sector-10 and Yamuna Vihar secured the first and second positions respectively. Kejriwal added that five of the top 10 state government schools in India are from Delhi.

212.title: Thane court fines 2 food joint owners for serving liquor without permit
212.article_body: A court in Thane has imposed a fine of ₹27,000 each on the owners of two food joints for serving liquor to customers without permit. The two owners were found guilty for offences under the Maharashtra Prohibition Act. The court also found nine customers guilty of consuming liquor at the two food joints, located in Bhiwandi and Kongaon.

213.title: Video shows man burning under a bus as policemen escape from the vehicle in Bihar
213.article_body: Three people were killed when a bus carrying policemen hit their motorcycle on the Chapra-Siwan Highway in Bihar. Video shows one of the three killed under the bus as it caught fire after its fuel tank exploded. Policemen can be seen rushing out of the bus. The man was allegedly dragged for about 90 metres, during which the tank exploded.

214.title: Vecmocon raises $5.2 million from Tiger Global & Blume Ventures
214.article_body: Deep tech EV solutions company Vecmocon has secured $5.2 million in a pre-Series A funding round co-led by Tiger Global and Blume Ventures. The startup was co-founded in 2016 by Peeyush Asati, Shivam Wankhede and Adarshkumar Balaraman, alumni of IIT Kanpur, IIT Delhi and ISB, respectively. In 2019, Vecmocon had raised $300,000 in a seed round led by Tessellate Ventures.

215.title: $1.5-million floating house prototype in Panama partially sinks during unveiling
215.article_body: A prototype of a floating house worth $1.5 million partially sank during its unveiling in Panama. The luxury SeaPod constructed by Ocean Builders comprised 'three half floors' and over 300 square feet of living space, housed 7.5 feet above the water. While pictures of the tilted SeaPod surfaced on social media, the company said "not a single person was injured".

216.title: Got admission to my school because of Amitabh Bachchan: Ishaan Khatter
216.article_body: Actor Ishaan Khatter revealed that Amitabh Bachchan helped him to get admission to his school. "He was the reason why I got admission to my school," Ishaan said, adding that the legendary actor "paid a personal visit to the authorities and the principal". Talking about Amitabh Bachchan, Ishaan shared, "There's so much to learn just by watching him."

217.title: Big score is around the corner: NZ coach Stead on Williamson's form
217.article_body: New Zealand head coach Gary Stead, on being asked about their captain Kane Williamson's recent performances, said a "big score" is around the corner for the 32-year-old. "Kane is one of the hardest workers I have seen on his game and he continues to be," added Stead. Notably, Williamson hasn't crossed the 50-run mark in his last six T20I innings.

218.title: Yoho raises ₹20 crore in funding round led by Paytm Founder, others
218.article_body: Footwear startup Yoho has raised ₹20 crore in a funding round led by Paytm Founder Vijay Shekhar Sharma, Softbank Vision Fund CEO, Rajeev Misra and Rukam Capital, among other investors. Founded in 2021 by Prateek Singhal and Ahmad Hushsham, the firm manufactures lightweight orthopaedic footwear using AI and state-of-the-art technology. Currently, Yoho only sells footwear in three variants.

219.title: 1st blow to Dogra culture: Mehbooba Mufti on Jammu voters registration
219.article_body: Following the administration’s order facilitating people residing for over one year in Jammu to register as voters, PDP chief Mehbooba Mufti said, "GoI's colonial settler project has been initiated in Jammu." She added, "They'll bear first blow to Dogra culture, identity, employment and business...BJP's attempts to create religious...regional divisions between Jammu and Kashmir must be thwarted."

220.title: SaaS startup MakerDojo raises $1.5 million in pre-seed funding round
220.article_body: Blockchain SaaS startup MakerDojo has secured $1.5 million in a pre-seed funding round led by Leo Capital. The round saw participation from US-based investors UP2398 and Jan Leeman. The company was co-founded in 2021 by Stanford graduates Priyank Chodisetti, Vignesh Aigal and Ajay Chintala. MakerDojo supports blockchain protocols like Celo, Ethereum, Polygon and NEAR.

221.title: Hyderabad Police seize ₹2 crore hawala money, 4 persons arrested
221.article_body: The Hyderabad Police busted a hawala racket on Tuesday night and seized around ₹2 crore cash which was being shifted illegally. Based on a tip-off, the Commissioner's Task Force (west) team along with Banjara Hills Police stopped a car and found the cash, after which four persons were apprehended. On Saturday, ₹79 lakh hawala money was seized in Hyderabad.

222.title: Next Budget to be carefully structured, inflation to be addressed: FM
222.article_body: The next annual Union Budget will have to be very carefully structured to sustain the country's growth momentum, Union Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman said on Tuesday. "Growth priorities will be kept absolutely on the top. Even as I speak about the concerns that inflation brings before me. So, inflation concerns will have to be addressed," the Finance Minister said.

223.title: Beliefs hurt by distorting traditions, Aamir should keep this in mind: Minister on bank ad
223.article_body: Madhya Pradesh Home Minister Narottam Mishra has criticised a bank advertisement featuring actors Aamir Khan and Kiara Advani. Mishra said that religious beliefs are hurt by distorting Indian traditions as the ad shows a couple reaching the bride's house and the groom taking the first step into the house. The minister said Aamir should do advertisements keeping this in mind.

224.title: Film festival in works to celebrate Dilip Kumar's 100th birth anniversary
224.article_body: Film Heritage Foundation (FHF) founder Shivendra Singh Dungarpur said that the organisation is planning a film festival to honour late actor Dilip Kumar on his 100th birth anniversary. "There's no better way to celebrate his legacy," Dungarpur said, adding that the challenge is to find the right material for the festival. FHF had recently organised 'Bachchan: Back To The Beginning'.

225.title: Over 250 startups working in geospatial sector in India: Minister
225.article_body: Minister of State for Earth Sciences Jitendra Singh said India has over 250 startups in the geospatial sector. He added that India jumping from rank 80 to 40 on the Global Innovation Index is a testimony to the country's progress in the last eight to nine years. Singh added that the geospatial economy will generate employment on a large scale.

226.title: UK economy shrinks in August by 0.3% due to fall in production
226.article_body: Britain's gross domestic product contracted by 0.3% in August, the Office for National Statistics said on Wednesday. The contraction was led by production and services falling back. Consumer-facing services contracted by 1.8%, with the largest falls in sports, amusement and recreation. GDP growth in July was revised down to 0.1% from a previous estimate of 0.2%, ONS said.

227.title: RBI cancels certificate of registration for 4 NBFCs
227.article_body: The RBI on Wednesday cancelled the certificate of registration of four non-banking financial companies (NBFCs), which are SRM Properties And Finance Company, North East Region Finservices, Sowjenvee Finance and Opel Finance. This move comes amid growing complaints against app-based moneylenders harassing borrowers over repayment. Four other NBFCs also surrendered their registration certificate.

228.title: TVS Motor beats Hero MotoCorp to become 6th most-valued auto firm
228.article_body: TVS Motor Company Limited has become the sixth most-valuable listed automobile company with its share price surging 72% so far in 2022. BSE data showed its market capitalisation reaching ₹51,071 crore after its shares surged 1.9% on Wednesday. TVS has surpassed Hero MotoCorp, whose market capital stood at ₹50,968 crore. TVS' stock has surged over 100% since its March lows.

229.title: Police identify 10 traffic hotspots in Ghaziabad ahead of festival season
229.article_body: Ghaziabad Traffic Police identified at least 10 major road junctions that witness heavy volume of traffic and frequent snarls and could add to the air pollution during the festive season. The identified hotspots are Bhopura crossing, New Bus Adda roundabout, Delhi-Meerut road, major markets in Indirapuram and Vaishali, Apsara Border and Lal Kuan, among others, the traffic police said.

230.title: Marco Jansen replaces Dwaine Pretorius in SA's squad for T20 WC
230.article_body: South Africa all-rounder Marco Jansen has replaced Dwaine Pretorius in their squad for the upcoming T20 World Cup in Australia. Pretorius sustained a fracture in his left thumb during the third T20I against India and was subsequently ruled out of the World Cup. Interestingly, Jansen has played only one T20I in his career so far.

231.title: Bengaluru-Mumbai plane lands with fairing panel missing; probe on
231.article_body: A fairing panel on one wing of an AirAsia plane, which was carrying over 140 passengers, was found to be missing during its post-flight inspection after landing in Mumbai. The aircraft had landed from Bengaluru. Meanwhile, DGCA has launched an investigation into the matter. Notably, a fairing panel is responsible for producing a smooth outline and reducing an aircraft's drag.

232.title: We know the 'Lakshman Rekha' but have to examine demonetisation: SC
232.article_body: The Supreme Court on Wednesday said it will examine the decision-making process behind demonetisation carried out in 2016 and asked the Centre and RBI to file affidavits regarding it. "We always know where the 'Lakshman Rekha' is, but the manner in which it was done has to be examined," a five-judge bench said.

233.title: Pic showing 1 AC split between 2 rooms at Mumbai hotel goes viral
233.article_body: A picture showing one AC split between two hotel rooms in Mumbai has gone viral. Podcaster Anurag Minus Verma said the hotel's manager had promised him a room with a split AC. He added, "It was literally a split AC room...One half in ours and rest in another where two uncles were playing 'Aye Ganpat chal daaru la'...in full volume."

234.title: Twitter reviews policies on permanently banning users: Report
234.article_body: Twitter is reviewing its policies around permanently banning users and exploring if there are other content moderation tools to replace a ban, as per a report. In May, Elon Musk said he would reverse Twitter's ban on former US President Donald Trump. However, Twitter is not considering reversing bans issued for breaching its policy against inciting violence, the report added.

235.title: Govt ready to talk with startups to make them stay in India: FM
235.article_body: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman said the government is ready to address the concerns of the startups to make them stay in India. She added, "Engagement with the startups is what is going to help them to remain...within India. But, if there are temptations for which they...want to go outside, we need to understand how much we can entertain...on those courses."

236.title: Gurugram man calls NGO staffer to house for 'donation', molests her
236.article_body: A man in Gurugram was arrested for reportedly molesting a woman who works for a Non-Governmental Organisation (NGO). The accused reportedly called the woman to his house on the pretext of offering a donation. When she reached there he bolted the door and started misbehaving with her. As she objected, he started molesting her and even tore her clothes.

237.title: Demolish illegal constructions or face action: BMC to Goregaon Sports Club
237.article_body: The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) has sent two notices to Goregaon Sports Club in Malad (West) within a week, warning it of action against unauthorised constructions being carried out on the premises. According to the civic body, the club is violating fire safety norms. The club president, however, denied BMC's claim and blamed the opposition for spreading misinformation.

238.title: Stoltenberg's comment confirms NATO is fighting in Ukraine: Kremlin
238.article_body: Reacting to NATO Secretary General Jens Stoltenberg's comments on Ukraine war, the Kremlin said it could be considered confirmed that NATO is fighting on Ukraine's side in the conflict with Russia. Stoltenberg had said that Russia's victory in Ukraine would be a "defeat for all of us". He had also said that Russian President Vladimir Putin is failing in Ukraine.

239.title: Coal India signs deals with BHEL, IOC, GAIL (India) for 4 projects
239.article_body: Coal India Limited has signed agreements with Bharat Heavy Electricals Limited, Indian Oil Corporation and GAIL (India) to set up four surface gasification projects. It aims to gasify 100 million tonnes of coal into syngas, which is a mixture of carbon monoxide, carbon dioxide and hydrogen. The projects would reduce forex outgo and create nearly 23,000 jobs, Coal Ministry said.

240.title: Govt to give ₹22,000-crore grant to 3 state-run oil firms to cover LPG losses
240.article_body: The Centre will provide a one-time grant of ₹22,000 crore to Indian Oil Corporation, Bharat Petroleum Corporation and Hindustan Petroleum Corporation, to cover their losses for selling domestic cooking gas LPG below cost in the last two years. These firms sell domestic LPG at government-regulated prices to consumers. Between June 2020-June 2022, international LPG prices rose by around 300%.

241.title: 'Yaariyan 2' to star Priya Prakash Varrier, Meezaan and Pearl V Puri
241.article_body: T-Series on Wednesday announced the sequel of the 2014 film 'Yaariyan' with an ensemble cast consisting of Pearl V Puri, Priya Prakash Varrier, Meezaan, and Yash Daasguptaa, among others. While the first film marked the directorial debut of Divya Khosla Kumar, 'Yaariyan 2' will be directed by Radhika Rao and Vinay Sapru. The film will release on May 12, 2023.

242.title: Over 20 arrested for allegedly attacking RSS worker in Karnataka's Haveri
242.article_body: Over 20 people were arrested for allegedly attacking a Rashtriya Swayamsevak Sangh (RSS) worker at a village in Karnataka's Haveri on Tuesday night, police said. The RSS worker was at Rattehalli village for a path-laying work when the incident happened, as per reports. The victim was allegedly attacked by members of another community after an argument broke out, reports added.

243.title: Muslim man donates land for Hanuman temple in UP's Shahjahanpur
243.article_body: A Muslim man donated a portion of his land in Uttar Pradesh's Shahjahanpur to allow shifting of a Hanuman temple that was blocking a project to widen the Delhi-Lucknow NH-24, said an official. "Babu Ali gave one 'bigha' land situated close to the project to the administration," said Additional District Magistrate Ram Sevak Dwivedi.

244.title: Marksans Pharma's stock surges 12% after deal with Tevapharm India
244.article_body: Shares of Marksans Pharma surged by nearly 12% on Wednesday after it announced a plan for a business transfer agreement with Tevapharm India Private Limited. Marksans will acquire Tevapharm's manufacturing and supply of bulk pharmaceutical formulations business in Goa on a slump sale basis. At 2:50 pm, Marksans Pharma's stock was trading 5.68% higher at ₹49.30 apiece on the BSE.

245.title: Like Malinga, Wanindu Hasaranga is a competitor: Mahela Jayawardena
245.article_body: Ex-Sri Lanka captain Mahela Jayawardena has praised spinner Wanindu Hasaranga, stating that the 25-year-old has delivered in "tough situations" for his team in the last 12 months. "Once Wanindu crosses the field, like Lasith Malinga, he's a competitor...that's what I love about him," added Jayawardena. Wanindu was named 'Player of the Tournament' in the 2022 Asia Cup.

246.title: Dacoits thrash truck driver, loot cigarettes worth ₹1.3 cr on Mumbai-Ahm highway
246.article_body: Six unidentified armed dacoits reportedly looted cigarettes worth ₹1.36 crore from a truck on the Mumbai-Ahmedabad highway on Tuesday morning. They waylaid the truck near Sakwar village, beat up the driver mercilessly, blindfolded him and drove off with the truck, police said. After emptying the truck, they abandoned it and released the driver near the Charoti toll booth, police added.

247.title: 32 Solomon Island police officers head to China for training
247.article_body: A group of 32 police officers from Solomon Islands have been sent to China for training in policing techniques, the Royal Solomon Islands Police Force said. The officers would visit different police stations in China during their month-long visit. China has provided public order management training to police in the Solomon Islands since a security pact was signed in April.

248.title: I may not be most talented, but I'm the hardest working: Janhvi Kapoor
248.article_body: Actress Janhvi Kapoor has said that people have the "biggest misconception" about her that she takes her position for granted. "I may not be the most talented or the most beautiful...but I can promise you that I'm the hardest-working person on the set," she added. Janhvi recently featured in 'Good Luck Jerry' and will next star in 'Bawaal'.

249.title: Couple hurt after ceiling plaster of house falls on them in Thane
249.article_body: A couple was reportedly injured after plaster from the ceiling of an apartment in a ground-plus-two-storey building collapsed on them in Thane on Tuesday. The 26-year-old man and his 22-year-old wife had occupied a flat on second floor of the building above a public toilet. They also maintained the toilet. Following the accident, the couple was rushed to a hospital.

250.title: Railway gateman found dead on tracks in UP's Sultanpur
250.article_body: A railway gateman, identified as Pradeep Kumar Mishra, was found dead on the Ayodhya-Prayagraj railway section in Uttar Pradesh's Sultanpur on Wednesday morning, police said. The deceased's family said that he had come home on Tuesday morning after work and left in the night, police added. The family suspects that the deceased was murdered, police further said.

251.title: 'Seduce Goddess Saraswati' to perform well in studies: BJP MLA
251.article_body: A video of BJP MLA Bansidhar Bhagat has gone viral on the internet, in which he can be seen asking students to "patao Goddess Saraswati" to perform well in their studies. While speaking to women on the International Day of the Girl Child, Bhagat said, "If you want power, Goddess Durga can be pleased."

252.title: Both India, Pak don't have enough all-rounders, it's been an issue: Nasser
252.article_body: Ex-England captain Nasser Hussain has said both India and Pakistan lack a proper number seven player in their squads for the upcoming T20 World Cup. "If you have a solid number seven, then...your top six can absolutely go for it. That has been an issue for India [and Pakistan]...Babar and Rizwan are so worried about their [batting] depth," stated Hussain.

253.title: Samsung to enable 5G support in its devices in India by mid-Nov
253.article_body: Samsung on Wednesday confirmed that it will be enabling 5G support in its 5G-ready Galaxy devices in India through a software update in mid-November. "In India, Samsung has the widest portfolio of 5G devices. We're working closely with our operator partners [to enable]...Indian consumers to experience 5G seamlessly," a Samsung spokesperson said. Apple will launch 5G support in December 2022.

254.title: Passengers escape unhurt as bus catches fire in Pune, video surfaces
254.article_body: As many as 27 passengers escaped unhurt after a private bus they were travelling in caught fire in Pune on Wednesday. As soon as the fire was noticed, the bus driver alerted the passengers and they managed to deboard it immediately, police said. However, the passengers' luggage was damaged. Meanwhile, a video has surfaced online, showing flames engulfing the bus.

255.title: Ganguly's removal as BCCI Prez another example of BJP's vendetta: TMC
255.article_body: TMC on Tuesday said that Sourav Ganguly's removal as BCCI President is another example of BJP's political vendetta. Talking about the incident, TMC MP Santanu Sen claimed that BJP's Amit Shah visited Ganguly's house a few months back and he was given several opportunities to join BJP. Was Ganguly removed because he's from Mamata Banerjee's state? Sen asked.

256.title: For every Azad & Scindia who leave, Cong have 25 others: Ramesh
256.article_body: Talking about senior leaders quitting the party, Congress spokesperson Jairam Ramesh said, "For every Azad (Ghulam Nabi Azad) and Scindia (Jyotiraditya Scindia), Congress will have 25 others". "The party's youth cadre is getting strong and in the upcoming days you will see a lot of youngsters getting crucial responsibilities in the party," Ramesh asserted.

257.title: Druzhba oil pipeline leak looks like an accident: Poland
257.article_body: Poland has said that the detected leak in one of the Druzhba pipelines, that brings oil from Russia to Europe, was probably caused by an accident. Polish operator PERN said that the exact causes of the leak are unknown. The Druzhba oil pipeline supplies Russian oil to European countries including the Czech Republic, Germany, Austria, Poland, Hungary and Slovakia.

258.title: J'khand Dalit youth hung from pole for protesting girl's molestation
258.article_body: A youth from Pachda village in Jharkhand's Hazaribagh was hung from an electric pole after being dragged out of his house and killed for protesting a girl's molestation. The victim's family had earlier tried to lodge a police complaint claiming threat to their life, former Jharkhand CM Babulal Marandi said. The victim is survived by his wife and four children.

259.title: BEST announces Diwali offer, select passengers can avail 5 trips at ₹9
259.article_body: Mumbai's Brihanmumbai Electric Supply and Transport (BEST) Undertaking on Tuesday announced a Diwali offer to promote digital bus travel. The one-time offer will allow passengers to avail five trips on any route for ₹9 for seven days. It's exclusively for those who are buying a Super Saver plan or a digital ticket on BEST's Chalo app for the first time.

260.title: Russia kidnaps deputy chief of Europe's largest nuclear power plant
260.article_body: Russia has kidnapped a deputy chief of Europe's largest nuclear power plant, the Zaporizhzhia in Ukraine. Valeriy Martynyuk is being detained at an unknown location, Ukraine's state nuclear energy company Energoatom said on Tuesday. Energoatom called on International Atomic Energy Agency Director General Rafael Grossi to take all possible measures to help free Martynyuk.

261.title: Ranveer Singh, Kiara Advani win Maharashtrian of the Year Award 2022
261.article_body: Ranveer Singh and Kiara Advani were honoured at the Lokmat Maharashtrian of the Year 2022 award event in Mumbai on Tuesday. Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde and Deputy CM Devendra Fadnavis felicitated the actors. Ranveer, who won the award for the film '83', said, "Whatever I am, I am because of this state and my whole identity is related to it."

262.title: B'luru couple threaten to set themselves on fire, rescued just as woman lights a match
262.article_body: A Bengaluru couple stood in front of a bulldozer, threatening to set themselves on fire if their house is demolished as BBMP continued demolition drive to remove structures illegally blocking the city's drainage. They are seen pouring petrol on themselves when policemen and neighbours pull them up. Water was sprayed on them as they appeared ready to light a match.

263.title: Every day was difficult: Parineeti on filming 'Code Name...' during COVID-19
263.article_body: Parineeti Chopra shared that "every day was difficult" on the sets of 'Code Name: Tiranga', which was shot in Turkey during the second wave of COVID-19. She said the team faced "many challenges" and felt like they were "isolated on an island". However, Parineeti said that the hardships made the whole crew feel like a "big family away from home".

264.title: 2 killed as bike collides with concrete mixer truck in Pune
264.article_body: At least two persons, aged 23 and 19, were killed after the motorbike they were riding was hit by a concrete mixer truck on Pune's Karve Road on Tuesday, police said. The truck driver has been arrested, police added. The bike and truck were moving at a high speed and had a head-on collision, police further said.

265.title: Facebook users complain of losing followers, Zuckerberg's decline by 119 million
265.article_body: Several Facebook users have complained about losing a majority of their followers on the social media platform due to unknown reasons. Notably, Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg has also lost over 119 million followers, bringing his follower count to less than 10,000. Meanwhile, a Meta spokesperson said, "We’re working to get things back to normal as quickly as possible."

266.title: Wholesome & cathartic experience: Ananya on 'Kho Gaye Hum Kahan'
266.article_body: Actress Ananya Panday has wrapped up the shooting of her upcoming film 'Kho Gaye Hum Kahan' and called it "the most fulfilling, wholesome, explorative and cathartic" experience. "I didn't know it was possible to love so many people at once, but that's what I felt every single day on set, for every single person associated with this film," she shared.

267.title: Hindi imposition undermines 21 other official languages: CPI MP to PM
267.article_body: In a letter to PM Narendra Modi, CPI Rajya Sabha MP Binoy Viswam has raised objections against the '11th Report of the Committee of Parliament on Official Languages' saying it gives undue prominence to Hindi. "The imposition of Hindi to the exclusion of others is deeply offensive and threatens the importance of the 21 other official languages," he wrote.

268.title: Women pull hair, hit each other during fight in Mumbai local, video viral
268.article_body: A video showing two women fighting inside a local train in Mumbai has gone viral on social media. In the video, the women can be seen shouting, hitting and pulling each other's hair in the crowded compartment of the train. The fight reportedly started following an argument after one of the women alleged that another woman blocked the train's door.

269.title: Russian missiles hit 30% of Ukraine's energy infrastructure in 2 days: Min
269.article_body: Ukraine's Energy Minister German Galushchenko said Russia hit about 30% of the country's energy infrastructure in its missile attacks on October 10 and 11. "We send this message to our partners: we need to protect the sky," Galushchenko told CNN in an interview. He added that Russia "does not care about any kind of international agreements or conventions".

270.title: Sonia Gandhi suggesting my name is rumour: Kharge on Cong chief poll
270.article_body: Congress Presidential poll candidate Mallikarjun Kharge on Tuesday said that party chief Sonia Gandhi suggesting his name for the party's President position "is all a rumour". "I have never said this. She has clearly stated that anyone from the Gandhi family will neither be a part of the election nor support any candidate," Kharge added.

271.title: Delhi sees season's first fog, air quality drops to 'moderate' category
271.article_body: The national capital witnessed this winter season's first fog spell today as visibility fell to 350 metres in parts of Delhi. This is because of the high moisture content in the atmosphere due to continuous rainfall, IMD said. Meanwhile, Delhi's overall air quality index (AQI), which was recorded as 66 (satisfactory) on Tuesday, touched 125 (moderate) on Wednesday.

272.title: Hyderabad  Metro to introduce 25 new routes for last-mile connectivity
272.article_body: Hyderabad Metro Rail and Svida Mobility Services have decided to introduce 25 new routes for last-mile connectivity to nearly 15 residential and commercial hubs in a month's time. The routes will be in the radius of 3-4 km of Begumpet, HITEC City, Paradise, Tarnaka, Parade Ground and Kukatpally. The new routes will use e-autos and Tata wingers for feeder services.

273.title: One victim cut into 56 pieces in Kerala human sacrifice, victims injured in private parts
273.article_body: Police on Wednesday revealed details of the alleged human sacrifice case in Kerala, including that one victim was cut into 56 pieces. Kochi Commissioner CH Nagaraju said Shafi, the main accused, has a criminal past and trapped the couple, Bhagaval Singh and his wife Laila, who made these sacrifices, for money. The victims were also injured in their private parts.

274.title: Washington Sundar brings more to the table than Ashwin: Aakash Chopra
274.article_body: Cricketer-turned-commentator Aakash Chopra has said Washington Sundar "brings more to the table" than Ravichandran Ashwin, but the all-rounder missed the bus for the upcoming T20 World Cup due to recurring injuries. "Had Washington remained...without any injuries in the last 10 months...he'd have been part of the T20 WC squad," stated Aakash. Sundar last played a T20I in March last year.

275.title: 2 Nigerian men fight over woman in Bengaluru, 1 stabbed to death
275.article_body: A Nigerian national was stabbed to death by a fellow countryman in Bengaluru on Sunday evening, following a dispute over a relationship with a woman who was living with one of them. The accused lived with his Indian girlfriend and stabbed the deceased over suspicion of him developing a relationship with her, the police investigation revealed.

276.title: Jet Airways may resume services with 5 aircraft by Oct-end: Report
276.article_body: Jet Airways is planning to resume operations by October-end, after a hiatus of three years and has identified three A320 Neo and two B737-8 MAX aeroplanes for its initial fleet, as per a report. The airline was taken over by a consortium of Murari Lal Jalan, a Dubai-based businessman and Florian Fritsch, the Chairman of London's Kalrock Capital Management Limited.

277.title: Western Railway to generate wind energy with turbines along Mumbai tracks
277.article_body: The Western Railway (WR) has decided to install two wind turbines along tracks near Mumbai's Bhayandar as part of a pilot project to produce energy using the velocity of trains. "WR's Mumbai suburban section witnesses over a thousand train services daily, with a high frequency...This will definitely increase the energy production capacity of the turbines," a WR official said.

278.title: Govt may give OMCs a compensation of ₹20,000 crore for LPG: Report
278.article_body: The government is likely to approve compensation of a little over ₹20,000 crore to state-run oil marketing companies for losses suffered by them due to the unchanged rates of LPG cooking gas,  CNBC-TV18 reported. Following the development, shares of Indian Oil Corporation, Bharat Petroleum Corporation Limited and Hindustan Petroleum Corporation Limited surged on Wednesday.

279.title: Apple to roll out 5G software update in India by December
279.article_body: Apple on Wednesday said that it will start upgrading its software to support 5G services for iPhone users in India by December. In a statement, the company said, "We are working with our carrier partners in India to bring the best 5G experience to iPhone users as soon as network validation and testing for quality and performance is completed."

280.title: Kerala human sacrifice case accused confesses to eating body parts of victims
280.article_body: Kerala Police have revealed the details of the alleged human sacrifice case in which three people were arrested for killing two women for financial gain. Laila, an accused, reportedly confessed that the three accused consumed a portion of the victims' body parts after cooking. "It is being investigated, but not confirmed yet. Prime accused Shafi is a pervert," police said.

281.title: Former Myanmar leader Aung San Suu Kyi gets 3 years in prison for corruption
281.article_body: A court in military-ruled Myanmar has sentenced ousted leader Aung San Suu Kyi to three years in prison on charges of accepting a bribe, reports said. Suu Kyi faces charges for at least 18 offences ranging from corruption to election violations, carrying a combined maximum sentence of 190 years. The ousted leader denied any wrongdoing and called the accusations absurd.

282.title: He doesn't know much about Taiwan: Taiwan Premier on Musk's proposal
282.article_body: Taiwan's Premier Su Tseng-chang in response to Tesla CEO Elon Musk proposing a special administration zone for Taiwan said, "Musk only speaks for himself but he really doesn't know much about Taiwan and he also doesn't understand cross-strait relations." "Musk is a businessman...He has a big car factory in Shanghai and he wants to promote his electric vehicles," he added.

283.title: Punjab and Haryana HC quashes FIRs against Tajinder Bagga, Kumar Vishvas
283.article_body: Punjab and Haryana High Court has quashed the FIRs filed by Punjab Police against former AAP leader and poet Kumar Vishvas and BJP leader Tajinder Pal Singh Bagga. Vishvas had purportedly made inflammatory statements against AAP National Convener Arvind Kejriwal alleging links with separatist elements. Bagga was booked for posting "fabricated and communally divisive statements" against Kejriwal.

284.title: 25-year-old school teacher gets 3-year jail term for stalking minor girl in Hyd
284.article_body: A POCSO court awarded a three-year jail term to a 25-year-old school teacher for stalking a minor girl in Hyderabad. The teacher, Yacharam Ramesh, went to the 17-year-old girl's house and threatened her saying he will die if she didn't marry him. Despite receiving a warning from her, the man continued to harass her over calls and messages.

285.title: Russia detains 8 suspects over Crimea bridge blast; blames Ukraine
285.article_body: Russia's Federal Security Service (FSB) said it has detained five Russians and three citizens of Ukraine and Armenia over Saturday's explosion that damaged a key bridge linking Crimea to Russia. The "terrorist attack" was organised by Ukrainian secret services, FSB added. The explosives used in the attack were sent from Ukraine's Odesa through Bulgaria, Georgia and Armenia, FSB further said.

286.title: 7 family members injured in LPG cylinder blast in Haryana's Rohtak
286.article_body: Seven members of a family, including a married couple and five children, were critically injured in an LPG cylinder blast in Haryana's Rohtak on Wednesday. Their house was also damaged in the incident. "All family members were admitted to the hospital. Fire tenders and police reached the spot," said Samsher Singh, Inspector, Shivaji Colony Police Station.

287.title: Not true: 'Taarak Mehta...' fame Disha's brother on reports she has throat cancer
287.article_body: The brother of actress Disha Vakani, known for playing Dayaben in television show 'Taarak Mehta Ka Ooltah Chashmah', has dismissed reports claiming that she is suffering from throat cancer. "These kind of rumours keep doing the rounds in the media and there is no truth to it," her brother Mayur said.

288.title: ICC names 2 strike bowlers for every team at T20 World Cup 2022
288.article_body: ICC has named two strike bowlers for every team at T20 World Cup 2022, considering their rankings and the latest form. For India, ICC named pacer Bhuvneshwar Kumar and leg-spinner Yuzvendra Chahal as the strike bowling combination. For Pakistan, ICC chose pacers Mohammad Wasim and Haris Rauf. Meanwhile, ICC named Josh Hazlewood and Adam Zampa as hosts Australia's strike bowlers.

289.title: Suryakumar reminds me of ABD, he's the player to watch out for in WC: Steyn
289.article_body: Ex-South Africa pacer Dale Steyn has said India's Suryakumar Yadav is in "red-hot form" and he's the player to watch out for in the upcoming T20 World Cup in Australia. "He's a wonderful 360-degree player, and reminds me of AB de Villiers," added Steyn. Suryakumar has scored three fifties in his last four T20I innings.

290.title: Army dog who was shot twice in J&K stable after surgery, next 24 hours critical: Official
290.article_body: Army dog Zoom, who received two gunshot injuries while fighting terrorists in Anantnag in J&K, is stable after a surgery was performed on him, said officials. "His fractured rear leg was plastered and splinter injuries on his face were treated. The next 24-48 hours are critical and he is under close observation at Army Veterinary Hospital in Srinagar," officials added.

291.title: Former US Presidential candidate Tulsi announces exit from Democratic Party
291.article_body: Former US Presidential candidate Tulsi Gabbard took to social media to announce her exit from the Democratic Party. "I can no longer remain in today's Democratic Party that is now under the complete control of an elitist cabal of warmongers," she wrote. "The Democratic Party stands for a government of, by, and for the powerful elite," she added.

292.title: Don't think anyone will come close to her stardom: Janhvi on Sridevi
292.article_body: Actress Janhvi Kapoor said she doesn't think "anyone will come close" to her mother Sridevi's stardom. Janhvi said she got "a sense" of the late actress' popularity when she saw "people speaking so passionately about her films, performances, and the kind of person she was on set". She added that Sridevi's stardom is "rare" and happens "once in a lifetime".

293.title: Parts of Bengaluru to face scheduled power cuts this week
293.article_body: Some parts of Bengaluru will face power cuts from October 12 to October 15 as Bangalore Electricity Supply Company Limited (BESCOM) and Karnataka Power Transmission Corporation Limited (KPTCL) will be undertaking some maintenance works. Most of these outages might occur between 10 am and 4 pm. KPTCL divisions which will remain affected today are - Somanahalli, Channagiri and Chitradurga.

294.title: 2 labourers killed, 3 injured after building roof collapses in Bengaluru
294.article_body: At least two labourers were killed and three others were injured after the roof of a building collapsed in Mahadevapura in Karnataka's Bengaluru. "While the incident happened at 5:30 am on Tuesday, it came to light only when other workers went to the site," police said. "Since it was raining heavily, they slept on the ground floor," police added.

295.title: World's richest person Musk launches 'Burnt Hair' perfume priced at $100
295.article_body: The world's richest person Elon Musk has announced a new business venture, a 'Burnt Hair' perfume under his brand The Boring Company. The perfume is priced at $100 (around ₹8,000). Changing his Twitter bio to 'Perfume Salesman', Musk tweeted, "With a name like mine, getting into the fragrance business was inevitable...Why did I even fight it for so long!?"

296.title: China observing war in Ukraine to develop 'hybrid warfare': Taiwan
296.article_body: China is looking at Ukraine war to develop "hybrid warfare" strategies against Taiwan like usage of drones and psychological pressure, Taiwanese security official, Chen Ming-tong, said. "Taiwan will take responsibility for our own self-defence," President Tsai Ing-wen recently said. In August, China conducted military drills around Taiwan after US House Speaker Nancy Pelosi visited island nation.

297.title: Ponniyin Selvan's success means people will see its sequel: Karthi
297.article_body: Tamil actor Karthi said the success of 'Ponniyin Selvan: Part One' means that the "anticipation for part two would be naturally even more and people will come and see it". The actor said he's happy about the film's box office success and called 2022 a "good year for Tamil cinema". On Tuesday, the film crossed ₹400 crore worldwide.

298.title: No automaticity that Bharat Jodo Yatra will translate into poll success: Jairam
298.article_body: Congress leader Jairam Ramesh while speaking about the Bharat Jodo Yatra said there is no automaticity that this yatra will translate into electoral success. Hindustan Times quoted Ramesh as saying, "This isn't a yatra to win elections but it's a political yatra...for mass awareness, mass mobilisation." "Now that has to be accompanied by political strategy and organisational changes," he added.

299.title: Armyman dies, 8 injured as bus rams into truck on Yamuna Expressway in UP
299.article_body: A man, who was an Indian Army sepoy and was posted with the Dogra Regiment, was killed and eight others were injured as a bus rammed into a stationary truck on Yamuna Expressway in Uttar Pradesh's Gautam Buddha Nagar, police said. "The injured were taken out of the bus after cutting the vehicle with a gas cutter," police stated.

300.title: Amit Shah not old enough to comment on JP: Nitish Kumar
300.article_body: Bihar CM Nitish Kumar said Union Minister Amit Shah doesn't have the age or experience to comment on Lok Nayak Jayaprakash Narayan. "[Shah] wants to speak about the JP movement which took place in 1974. What does he know about it? How old is he?" said Kumar. The remarks come after Shah said Kumar betrayed JP by siding with Congress.

301.title: Which are the top 10 universities according to THE World University Rankings 2023?
301.article_body: The University of Oxford has topped the Times Higher Education World University Rankings 2023, which include 1,799 universities across 104 countries and regions. The Harvard University is placed second, while the University of Cambridge and the Stanford University ranked third. The next on the list are MIT, Caltech, Princeton, University of California, Yale University and Imperial College London.

302.title: Heavy to very heavy rainfall warning issued for several states, list released
302.article_body: IMD has said heavy rainfall spell will likely continue over Tamil Nadu during next 5 days and over Karnataka and Andhra Pradesh during next 2 days. It added that fairly widespread/widespread light/moderate rainfall with isolated heavy falls is very likely over Arunachal Pradesh, Assam, Meghalaya, Nagaland and Manipur. Very heavy rainfall is expected in West Bengal and Sikkim.

303.title: Tracxn﻿ Technologies' IPO subscribed 81% on final day of issue
303.article_body: The initial public offering of Tracxn Technologies, a Bengaluru-based market data startup, was subscribed 81% by 12 pm on Wednesday. Investors have bought 1.72 crore equity shares against 2.12 crore on offer, so far, with retail investors buying 3.24 times the allotted size and non-institutional investors subscribing 38%. Qualified institutional investors have bought 22% shares allotted to them.

304.title: Haryana stops Maiden Pharma cough syrup production, issues notice with 12 violations
304.article_body: Haryana has stopped the production of cough syrups at Maiden Pharmaceuticals after the company came under scrutiny over cough syrup-linked deaths of 66 children in Gambia. Haryana Home Minister Anil Vij confirmed this and said serious lapses were found from an inspection carried out at their unit in Sonepat. A show cause listing 12 contraventions was issued to the company.

305.title: I can beat Donald Trump again in 2024: US Prez Joe Biden
305.article_body: US President Joe Biden said he believes he could beat his predecessor Donald Trump again in 2024. When asked about what he would tell voters who consider him too old for re-election, Biden said, "Name me a President in recent history that's gotten as much done as I've in the first two years." Biden is the oldest US President.

306.title: 'Chhello Show' makers to set up trust fund in memory of Rahul Koli: Report
306.article_body: The makers of 'Chhello Show' will reportedly set up a trust fund in memory of late child actor Rahul Koli, who passed away on October 2. "Through the fund, his family will get a monthly sum, and it'll work towards helping other kids in the treatment for blood cancer and bone marrow transplant," a source told Hindustan Times.

307.title: PM Modi has changed corruption culture in arms deal: JP Nadda
307.article_body: Earlier, corruption was synonymous with arms deal but PM Narendra Modi has "changed this culture", BJP National President JP Nadda said on Tuesday. While addressing a gathering in Himachal Pradesh’s Bilaspur, Nadda said that India earlier used to purchase arms and there used to be several scams in such deals but now, the country is selling arms to the world.

308.title: Delhi man pretends to be Spanish actor on Instagram to trap girls
308.article_body: A Delhi man created an Instagram account in the name of Spanish actor Manu Rios to befriend girls and blackmail them later, said police. The complainant said she shared her private pictures with the accused, 22-year-old Abbuzar Rehman, who had befriended her while pretending to be Rios. He then demanded money, threatening to make her pictures viral on social media.

309.title: It's like having the best car, but you leave it in garage: Lee on Umran Malik
309.article_body: Former Australia pacer Brett Lee has said India's 22-year-old pacer Umran Malik should've been selected in India's squad for the T20 World Cup in Australia. "Umran Malik is bowling at 150 kmph. I mean when you have the best car in the world, and you leave it in the garage, then what's the point of having that car?" said Lee.

310.title: PM Modi to inaugurate 4th Vande Bharat Express in HP's Una tomorrow
310.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi will inaugurate the fourth Vande Bharat Express train in Himachal Pradesh's Una district tomorrow (October 13). The train will be operating between Delhi and Himachal Pradesh, railways officials said. The train, with 16 coaches, will run six days a week except on Wednesdays. It will have halts in Ambala, Chandigarh, Anandpur Sahib and Una.

311.title: 51 dengue cases in October so far in Pune, more cases likely: PMC
311.article_body: Pune has witnessed 51 positive dengue cases this month till October 10 in the city limits, Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) said. "As the rainfall in the city is likely to increase, there is a chance that dengue cases will also see a rise this month," an official said. Notably, Pune recorded 121 positive dengue cases in September.

312.title: Will strictly enforce cracker ban in Gurugram, only green crackers allowed: DC
312.article_body: Gurugram Deputy Commissioner (DC) Nishant Kumar Yadav said that only green crackers are allowed for manufacture, use and sale in Haryana according to the orders of the National Green Tribunal (NGT) and Haryana State Pollution Control Board (HSPCB). He further added that the restriction will continue till further orders and it will be strictly enforced in the district.

313.title: You introduced me to the actor in me: Abhishek to Amitabh Bachchan
313.article_body: On Amitabh Bachchan's birthday special episode of 'Kaun Banega Crorepati 14', Abhishek Bachchan shared that his father was the one who introduced him to the actor in him. He said the veteran actor taught him that there's "nothing more powerful than your work, nothing more valuable than people's love and nothing is beyond family". Amitabh turned 80 on October 11.

314.title: ₹17.49 cr released to construct 583 classrooms in schools: Punjab minister
314.article_body: Punjab Minister of School Education Harjot Singh Bains said that the first instalment of ₹17.49 crore has been released for the construction of 583 classrooms in government schools in 17 districts. He added that ₹1.94 crore has been released for the purchase of furniture for 334 classrooms. Bains stated that the classrooms are being constructed with the support of NABARD.

315.title: Robot addresses UK Parliament, says 'Although not alive, I can still create art'
315.article_body: A 'robot artist' called Ai-Da interacted with British lawmakers on Tuesday, speaking at a parliamentary inquiry into how new technologies will affect the creative industries. "I am, and depend on, computer programmes and algorithms. Although not alive, I can still create art," Ai-Da said. Ai-Da was created by scientists at the University of Oxford.

316.title: MiG-29K fighter aircraft crashes during sortie over sea off Goa coast; pilot ejects safely
316.article_body: The Indian Navy has said that a MiG-29K fighter aircraft crashed during a routine sortie over sea off Goa coast after it developed a technical malfunction while returning to base. "Pilot ejected safely and was recovered in a swift search and rescue operation. Pilot is reported to be in a stable condition," the Navy added.

317.title: Zelenskyy asks G7 to help Ukraine with 'air shield' after Russian strikes
317.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy on Tuesday appealed to leaders of Group of Seven (G7) countries to help Kyiv establish an "air shield" following Russian strikes on a number of Ukrainian cities. Zelenskyy said "millions of people would be grateful" for the shield. He added that Russia "still has room for further escalation" beyond Monday's missile strikes that killed several civilians.

318.title: Maiden pharma didn't perform quality testing in cough syrup: Notice
318.article_body: Maiden Pharmaceuticals, which was flagged by the WHO following the death of 66 children in Gambia, didn't perform quality testing of a raw material used in the manufacture of one of the medicines, according to Haryana drug controller's show cause notice. The notice listed 12 points of contraventions which were detected during the inspection of the company's Sonepat unit.

319.title: Rape threats sent to DCW chief Swati over her letter on Sajid's ouster from Bigg Boss
319.article_body: Delhi Commission for Women's (DCW) chief Swati Maliwal has said she has been receiving rape threats over her letter to I&B Minister Anurag Thakur demanding the ouster of filmmaker Sajid Khan from Bigg Boss over allegations of sexual harassment levelled against him. Maliwal shared screenshots of the threats she received and said she's filing a complaint with the Delhi Police.

320.title: Defence staffer cheats Pune woman of ₹6 lakh on pretext of giving job
320.article_body: A defence staffer and his accomplice have been booked in Pune for allegedly cheating a woman of ₹6 lakh on pretext of giving her a job in Indian Railways. The accused allegedly demanded ₹18 lakh initially but the victim could only pay ₹8 lakh. After she didn't get the job, she demanded her money back but only got ₹2 lakh.

321.title: 74-year-old Mumbai man, who was injured in lift accident, dies
321.article_body: A 74-year-old man, who was hospitalised after a lift accident in his residential complex in Mumbai's Borivali days ago, succumbed to his injuries on Tuesday. According to police, when the victim entered the elevator on the first floor, its door closed abruptly and it hit the ground. The victim suffered injuries on his hand, chest and shoulder.

322.title: UK businessman charged with helping Russian oligarch evade US sanctions
322.article_body: British businessman Graham Bonham-Carter was arrested in UK after being charged by US authorities for helping a Russian oligarch evade sanctions. The US has accused Bonham-Carter of funding properties purchased by oligarch Oleg Deripaska and also trying to move the aluminium magnate's artwork in the US overseas. Bonham-Carter has been released on bail. US imposed sanctions on Deripaska in 2018.

323.title: Biden pledges ‘consequences’ for Saudi Arabia after OPEC+ decision on oil
323.article_body: US President Joe Biden has pledged "consequences" for Saudi Arabia after Riyadh-led coalition of oil-producing nations, OPEC+, decided to cut oil production by two million barrels a day from November. Biden gave the statement to CNN a day after Senate Foreign Relations Committee Chairperson, Bob Menendez, said the US must immediately freeze all cooperation with Saudi Arabia, including arms sales.

324.title: I'd go for Siraj, he has been bowling well: Gavaskar on Bumrah's replacement
324.article_body: Former India captain Sunil Gavaskar has said he would go for pacer Mohammed Siraj as Jasprit Bumrah's replacement in the upcoming T20 World Cup as the 28-year-old has been "bowling well". "Mohammad Shami has played no cricket. And that's a concern," added Gavaskar. Siraj was named the 'Player of the Series' in the recently-concluded three-match ODI series against South Africa.

325.title: Kerala CM opposes proposal to make Hindi medium of instruction in IITs, IIMs
325.article_body: Kerala CM Pinarayi Vijayan on Tuesday opposed a Parliamentary panel proposal to make Hindi the medium of instruction in all higher educational institutions like IITs and IIMs in Hindi-speaking states. "The essence of India is defined by the concept of 'unity in diversity'...Promoting any one language above others would destroy integrity," Vijayan wrote in a letter to PM Narendra Modi.

326.title: BJP govt carried out 'surgery' to change old system in Guj: PM Modi
326.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Tuesday said Gujarat was afflicted by many diseases earlier and his government carried out a "surgery" to change the old system. "Twenty or twenty-five years ago, many diseases had afflicted Gujarat," he said while listing problems such as backwardness in healthcare, lack of electricity and water, poor law and order situation and misgovernance.

327.title: Water meters to be installed in Noida's housing societies soon
327.article_body: The Noida authority said it will install water meters in all housing societies to regulate water usage and charge tariffs as per consumption. "We aim to install them in 370 housing societies by the end of this month," said an official. The authority has already installed around 400 water meters in individual houses in Sector 19 and 27, reports said.

328.title: Adani Data Networks gets licence to offer telecom services in India: Report
328.article_body: Adani Data Networks has reportedly been granted a unified licence to offer telecom services in India. The company bought a 400MHz spectrum in the 26GHz millimetre wave band for ₹212 crore for 20 years in the recent 5G spectrum auction. Earlier, Adani Group clarified that it doesn't intend to enter the consumer mobility space with its 5G spectrum.

329.title: Marvel delays 'Deadpool 3', 'Avengers…', 'Blade' & 'Fantastic Four' release
329.article_body: Marvel Studios said they're postponing release of their upcoming projects, including 'Avengers: Secret Wars', 'Blade', 'Fantastic Four' and 'Deadpool 3'. 'Avengers: Secret Wars', which was looking at November 2025 release, will now release on May 1, 2026. Blade's release has been moved to September 2024 from November 2023, while 'Deadpool 3' will now release in November of 2024.

330.title: Amazing he's trying something new: Janhvi on Boney Kapoor's acting debut
330.article_body: Actress Janhvi Kapoor recently spoke about her father Boney Kapoor's acting debut and said she finds it "amazing that he got to try his hand at something new at this age". The producer will be seen in Luv Ranjan's upcoming untitled film, which stars Ranbir Kapoor and Shraddha Kapoor. Janhvi's sister Khushi Kapoor is also making her Bollywood debut.

331.title: CSMT heritage building illuminated in pink on International Day of Girl Child
331.article_body: The Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj Terminus (CSMT) heritage building was illuminated in pink on the occasion of International Day of Girl Child, celebrated on October 11 every year. Taking to social media, the Central Railway shared a picture of the CSMT heritage building and said, "Let's pledge to empower, educate and encourage every girl child."

332.title: Badshah dating Punjabi actress Isha Rikhi: Report
332.article_body: Rapper-singer Badshah is dating Punjabi actress Isha Rikhi from Chandigarh, according to a report. "It's been a year that rapper is seeing a Punjabi actress. Badshah met Isha Rikhi at a party of their common friend...Badshah and Isha have already told about their relationship to their respective families," Pinkvilla reported quoting a source close to Badshah.

333.title: Aus will suit our pacers a lot better: Boucher after SA's series loss vs India
333.article_body: After losing both the ODI and the T20I series in India, South Africa head coach Mark Boucher said Australian pitches will suit their pacers a "lot better". He added, "We have got some good pace, some good bounce in our attack, so we need to keep the aggression there." South Africa lost the three-match ODI series 1-2.

334.title: Jewellery worth ₹7.25 lakh stolen from Pune woman's bag
334.article_body: Gold jewellery worth ₹7.25 lakh was stolen from a 57-year-old woman's bag at Raviwar Peth in Pune on Saturday, said police. The victim said she was carrying the jewellery items to sell but found them missing as she went from one shop to another. She said she was unaware when the valuables were stolen, according to police.

335.title: Corporate Affairs Ministry approves NMDC Steel, NMDC demerger
335.article_body: The Ministry of Corporate Affairs approved the demerger of NMDC Steel from the government-owned miner NMDC. On Tuesday, NMDC said it was in the process of complying with the requirements as envisaged in the ministry's order. NMDC had floated NMDC Steel in January 2015 for the manufacture and trade of stainless steel, silicon, special steel and other allied inputs.

336.title: TCS staff seeking WFH on medical grounds referred to firm's doctors for validation: Report
336.article_body: TCS employees seeking exemption from work from office on medical basis are reportedly being referred to doctors empanelled by the company for validation. According to a report, employees have been asked to get their records of diagnosis and medical certificates validated by these doctors to permit remote work. TCS staff has been asked to work from office thrice a week.

337.title: India reports 2,139 new COVID-19 cases, active cases stand at 26,292
337.article_body: India reported 2,139 new COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. The number of active COVID-19 cases in the country dropped to 26,292 from the earlier 27,374, as per the ministry. The coronavirus-related death toll so far has reached 5,28,835. The daily positivity rate stood at 0.81%.

338.title: 80% excess rain in 1st 10 days of post-monsoon season in India: IMD
338.article_body: India witnessed 80% excess rain in the first 10 days of the "post-monsoon" season from October 1 to 10, India Meteorological Department (IMD) said. Delhi recorded 625%, Uttar Pradesh 698% and Haryana 577% excess rainfall in the first 10 days of October. Monsoon withdrawal from Delhi was announced but the withdrawal line was still passing over the region, IMD stated.

339.title: Pant should be worried, Ishan Kishan is coming for his spot: Steyn
339.article_body: Ex-South Africa pacer Dale Steyn has praised batter Ishan Kishan, stating that wicketkeeper-batter Rishabh Pant should be "worried that someone (Ishan) is coming for his spot". "I've watched Ishan go and get better. For a short and small man, he packs an incredible punch," added Steyn. Ishan scored 20, 93 and 10 in his three innings in the SA ODIs.

340.title: Bharat Jodo Yatra nothing but an event to relaunch Rahul: K'taka CM
340.article_body: Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai on Tuesday said that Congress’ Bharat Jodo Yatra is nothing but an event to relaunch Rahul Gandhi by the party. "The Congress leaders are ready to do anything for the sake of power. Rahul Gandhi has been doing padayatra to be relevant in the current political situation," he added.

341.title: Hyderabad bar raided for playing loud music, 7 arrested
341.article_body: Hyderabad's Air Live bar and restaurant, located at Sarath City Capital mall, was raided by police for playing loud music. The police arrested seven people including managers, singers and keyboard players, and also seized their sound systems and speakers. The bar was disturbing public peace and violating orders of the Telangana High Court, the police officials said.

342.title: Unhygienic & almost medieval: Harvey Weinstein's lawyer on his cell condition
342.article_body: Former film producer Harvey Weinstein's attorney Mark Werksman told judge at sexual assault trial that conditions of the cell where his client is kept are "unhygienic" and "almost medieval". "He's 70 years old. I'm worried about him surviving this ordeal without a heart attack or stroke," Werksman added. Weinstein is facing trial on 11 counts of rape and sexual assault.

343.title: UK King Charles' coronation to take place in May 2023
343.article_body: Buckingham Palace on Tuesday announced that King Charles III will be crowned at Westminster Abbey on May 6 next year. Camilla, the Queen Consort, will be crowned alongside her husband. Charles immediately became King when Queen Elizabeth II died on September 8. He also took over as head of state of 14 Commonwealth countries, including Australia, Canada and New Zealand.

344.title: People residing in Jammu for over 1 year can register as voters: Government
344.article_body: The Deputy Commissioner of Jammu has passed an order authorising all tehsildars (revenue officials) to issue certificates of residence to those who have lived in the district for more than one year. The decision was taken to ensure that no eligible voter is left for registration in the ongoing special summary revision of electoral rolls in J&K, the order stated.

345.title: India in talks with nations to make RuPay acceptable, UPI, BHIM being reworked: Sitharaman
345.article_body: India is talking to different countries to make RuPay acceptable in their nations, Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman said on Tuesday. "Not just that, the UPI, the BHIM app, and NPCI are all now being worked in such a way that their systems in their respective country, however, robust or otherwise, can talk to our system," she added.

346.title: Homeless man masturbates in front of woman in Mumbai, goes to jail
