346.article_body: A 32-year-old homeless man was sentenced to six months jail by a Mumbai court after just two days of trial for insulting the modesty of a 23-year-old woman. According to the victim, she was out for a walk with her dog along the Kennedy Bridge when the man made lewd gestures and then started masturbating in front of her.

347.title: Asteroid's path altered after NASA deliberately crashes spacecraft into it
347.article_body: The spacecraft which NASA deliberately crashed into an asteroid last month succeeded in nudging the rocky moonlet from its natural path into a faster orbit, marking the first time humanity has altered motion of a celestial body. The DART mission also represented world's first test of a planetary defense system designed to prevent a potential doomsday meteorite collision with Earth.

348.title: Ankita Lokhande joins Randeep Hooda's 'Swatantra Veer Savarkar'
348.article_body: Actress Ankita Lokhande has been cast as the female lead of Randeep Hooda's 'Swatantra Veer Savarkar'. Confirming the news, Ankita said she loves to play "challenging and pivotal characters" that leave an impact on audience. "'Swatantra Veer Savarkar' is one such inspiring story that needs to be told and I'm happy to be associated with it," she added.

349.title: Biker beaten up for honking horn in Pune, admitted to hospital
349.article_body: A 23-year-old Pune resident was allegedly beaten up by a group of three people for honking his motorcycle's horn to clear his way. He was injured and admitted to a hospital. According to police, the victim, who was with a friend, got into a heated argument with three persons, who asked him to stop honking. A case has been filed.

350.title: Should support every Indian film for Oscar: 'Chhello Show' producer on 'RRR'
350.article_body: 'Chhello Show' producer Siddharth Roy Kapur said people "should support every Indian film" that's running for Oscars. Siddharth's statement has come in response to RRR's Oscar submission under 14 categories, including Best Director. "If more films are representing India, it increases our chances of bringing the Oscar back home, or at least, of bringing a nomination back home," he said.

351.title: Either 'jumla' or 'hamla', this is double engine govt PM talks about: KTR
351.article_body: Telangana Minister KT Rama Rao on Tuesday said PM Narendra Modi means "either jumla or hamla" when he talks about the double engine government. "If anyone is vocal like TRS, CM KCR, the Centre uses CBI, ED, IT and other agencies," he added. "By threatening, they will try to control," Rao stated.

352.title: Remains of 240 people, including kids, found under department store in UK
352.article_body: Remains of more than 240 people, including kids, have been unearthed by archaeologists working on the remnants of a medieval monastery found beneath a former department store. The discovery was made under the old Ocky White building in Haverfordwest, Pembrokeshire. According to archaeologists, the ruins are from St Saviour's Priory, founded by a Dominican order of monks in about 1256.

353.title: Man City, Real Madrid enter Champions League knockouts; Chelsea stun Milan
353.article_body: Manchester City and Real Madrid have become the first teams to enter the knockout phase of the ongoing Champions League after playing out draws in their respective matches on Tuesday night. City were held to a 0-0 draw by Copenhagen, while Madrid rescued a 1-1 draw in the last five minutes against Shakhtar Donetsk. Meanwhile, Chelsea defeated AC Milan 2-0.

354.title: 2-seater Chinese electric flying car makes 1st public test flight in Dubai, pics surface
354.article_body: An electric flying car built by the Chinese electronic vehicle maker Xpeng made its first public test flight in Dubai. Powered by eight propellers, the vehicle can carry two passengers and as per the company, it has a top speed of 130 km per hour. Several pictures and videos of the test flight also surfaced on social media.

355.title: 'Djinn' stole ₹41 lakh, believes Mumbai family; turns out inside job
355.article_body: The family of a Mumbai-based businessman reportedly lost ₹40.98 lakh in cash and jewellery in a series of thefts from their house. However, they were reluctant to file a case as they believed it was the work of a 'Djinn'. The police found out a 13-year-old girl, daughter of the businessman's sister, was stealing for her brother in Surat.

356.title: Several areas of Gurugram to face 3.5-hour-long power cut today
356.article_body: Eleven areas in Gurugram, including some housing commercial buildings, would face a 3.5-hour-long power cut from 9.30 am to 1 pm today. The decision of the planned power outage is taken because the Haryana Vidyut Prasaran Nigam Limited (HVPNL) will carry out annual maintenance work on one of its 66kV substations in DLF Block Q, power officials said.

357.title: Revenue official arrested for taking ₹4,000 bribe from farmer in Pune
357.article_body: Anti-Corruption Bureau officials in Pune arrested a revenue assistant for allegedly taking a bribe of ₹4,000 from a farmer to change the occupancy grade of the land allotted to him. The accused was allegedly demanding the bribe for executing an order that would change the grade, following which the farmer would be able to sell the land without government consent.

358.title: Almost every country slowing, India a bright spot compared to others: IMF
358.article_body: When everyone is slowing down in terms of economic growth, India has not remained unimpacted, but is doing better and is in a relatively bright spot, IMF Director of Asia and Pacific Department, Krishna Srinivasan, has said. The IMF in its World Economic Outlook projected a growth rate of 6.8% in 2022 as compared to 8.7% in 2021 for India.

359.title: Several buildings in Bengaluru's KR Puram, Whitefield demolished
359.article_body: Several encroachments on stormwater drains in Mahadevapura's KR Puram and Whitefield areas were bulldozed by the Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) on Tuesday as the civic body restarted anti-encroachment drives in the city. Concrete slabs, parts of compound walls and residential buildings were demolished in SR Layout in KR Puram. A compound wall near Sheelavanthakere Lake was also removed.

360.title: Intel plans to cut thousands of jobs amid PC market slowdown: Report
360.article_body: Chipmaker Intel is planning to cut thousands of jobs amid a slowdown in the personal computer market, as per a report. The job cuts will reportedly be announced as early as this month and may include employees from the sales and marketing divisions. Intel last made significant job cuts in 2016, when about 12,000 people were laid off.

361.title: What is a 'biscuit' in US' nuclear weapons launch process?
361.article_body: A "biscuit" contains the codes, known as Gold Codes, by which the US President can identify himself and authorise the use of nuclear weapons. A biscuit is about the size of a credit card. Recently, US President Joe Biden said the risk of nuclear 'Armageddon' is at the highest level since the 1962 Cuban Missile Crisis.

362.title: 21-yr-old man killed over using public toilet in Delhi, 2 brothers held
362.article_body: A 21-year-old man was killed following an argument with two brothers over using a public toilet in Delhi's Ashok Vihar area, police said. The accused have been arrested, police added. "The victim was previously involved in criminal cases...had threatened the two brothers with a surgical blade, after which they thrashed him...caused injuries to his head and chest," police stated.

363.title: Delhi records 97 fresh COVID-19 cases, 1 death in 24 hours
363.article_body: Delhi reported 97 new cases of COVID-19 with a positivity rate of 1.41% in the last 24 hours, the city health department informed on Tuesday. One death due to the infection was also recorded in the national capital. The city's active case count stood at 420, according to the daily COVID-19 bulletin. Delhi's total case tally has climbed to 20,04,284.

364.title: TN Guv speaking like 'RSS man': DMK on 'Dravidian identity' remark
364.article_body: The DMK said that the Tamil Nadu governor RN Ravi spoke like an 'RSS man' after he said that the concept of Dravidian has become Tamil identity due to politics of division. AIADMK echoed the Governor's sentiments and said that Dravidian geographically includes five states in southern India. "The Governor's remark does not merit attention", a senior DMK leader said.

365.title: Maharashtra logs 384 COVID-19 cases, four deaths in 24 hours
365.article_body: Maharashtra recorded 384 new cases of COVID-19 along with four deaths due to the infection in the last 24 hours, the state health department informed on Tuesday. Satara, Hingoli and Bhandara districts and Pune city logged one fatality each. Out of the fresh cases, 129 were reported from the state capital, Mumbai. Maharashtra's active case count stood at 2,387.

366.title: Railways plans to replace fuel-based vehicles with electric vehicles by 2025
366.article_body: As Centre plans to make India a 100% electric vehicle nation by 2030, the railways have floated a policy to replace its fuel-based vehicles, including those running on diesel, biofuels or natural gas, with electric vehicles by December 2025. A vast charging infrastructure would also be set up at major railway stations, office buildings and parking lots under the policy.

367.title: Want more compensation for Bhopal gas tragedy victims: Govt to SC
367.article_body: The Centre has told the Supreme Court that it wants to pursue a curative petition to provide additional compensation to victims of the 1984 Bhopal gas tragedy. As per the petition, the Centre is seeking ₹7,400 crore as an additional fund from successors of US-based Union Carbide. The Supreme Court posted the matter for hearing on January 10, 2023.

368.title: NATO to hold nuclear exercises next week despite Russian threats
368.article_body: Secretary-General of NATO Jens Stoltenberg on Tuesday said the military alliance will carry on with its nuclear exercises, dubbed "Steadfast Noon", next week, despite threats from Russian President Vladimir Putin. The exercise is held annually and goes on for about a week. The exercise involves fighter jets which can carry nuclear warheads, however, no live bombs are involved.

369.title: Former Pak PM Imran Khan booked for receiving 'prohibited funds'
369.article_body: Ousted Pakistani Prime Minister Imran Khan has been booked by the country's Federal Investigation Agency for allegedly receiving prohibited foreign funds. According to the FIR, the owner of Wooton Cricket Limited transferred "ill-gotten" funds to a bank account under Khan's party Pakistan Tehreek-e-Insaf. The party leaders are accused of violating the Foreign Exchange Act.

370.title: RBI modifies guidelines to manage forex exposure during volatility
370.article_body: The Reserve Bank of India (RBI) modified guidelines for banks to manage foreign currency exposure in times of forex volatility. The RBI said that banks have to provide a 25 percentage point increase in risk weight, if potential exposure from an entity's unhedged foreign currency exposure is over 75%. The RBI asked banks to ascertain the exposure annually at least.

371.title: Will try to win remaining races: Verstappen after winning world title
371.article_body: 2022 F1 world champion Max Verstappen said he will "definitely try" to win the remaining four races of the season. "There is no real pressure anymore but I still want to of course try and win more," said Verstappen. He added that he wanted to extend the current advantage as it may not be there "in the years to come".

372.title: Scientists discover new function of human brain's cerebellum
372.article_body: The primary function of the human brain's cerebellum is the regulation of movement. But scientists have recently discovered that the cerebellum also plays an important role in remembering emotional experiences. In the study that involved 1,418 participants, researchers found that the cerebellum showed an increase in brain activity of the participants while remembering positive and negative images.

373.title: Govt may give IDBI buyer free hand in running bank: Report
373.article_body: The government may offer the potential buyer, in the share purchase agreement of IDBI Bank, a free hand in running the bank. A government official said that they don't want to be a hindrance in the bank's functioning after the management control is passed to the buyer. The Centre and LIC are divesting 60.72% stake in IDBI Bank.

374.title: Mbappe seeking Jan transfer after feeling 'betrayed' by PSG: Report
374.article_body: PSG forward Kylian Mbappe is reportedly unhappy with the club and is looking for a transfer during the January window. Mbappe is said to be feeling "betrayed" as promises like a second striker alongside him and a new centre-back have not been fulfilled by the club. The forward's relationship with fellow striker Neymar is also said to be an issue.

375.title: If not reformed, UNSC will become irrelevant: S Jaishankar
375.article_body: The United Nations Security Council (UNSC) will become "irrelevant" if it is not reformed, said External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar on Tuesday. India has long demanded the Security Council be reformed and has also demanded a permanent seat in the UNSC. "Well, it's a hard nut but hard nuts can be cracked," said Jaishankar when asked about reforming the UNSC.

376.title: CCI directs 8 firms to cease and desist from unfair business practices
376.article_body: The Competition Commission of India directed eight firms and some of their officials to cease and desist from unfair business practices. CCI alleged the firms quoted identical bids in the tender floated for axle bearings which are used for certain railway coaches. The entities include Krishna Engineering Works, Chandra Brothers, Rama Engineering Works and Sriguru Melters & Engineers, among others.

377.title: India players dance to 'Bolo Ta Ra Ra' in dressing room after win, Dhawan shares video
377.article_body: Team India players danced to Daler Mehndi's song 'Bolo Ta Ra Ra' after winning the three-match ODI series against South Africa on Tuesday. Sharing the video, Shikhar Dhawan, who led the team in the series, wrote, "Jeet ke bolo Tara ra ra." Reacting to the video, a fan wrote, "POV: When Shikhar bhai is captain."

378.title: FA to employ lip reader for Henderson-Gabriel altercation probe: Report
378.article_body: The Football Association (FA) is reportedly set to employ a lip reader as part of their ongoing investigation into the altercation between Liverpool captain Jordan Henderson and Arsenal defender Gabriel. The incident took place when the two teams played against each other and a penalty was awarded to Arsenal. The FA started its investigation based on referee Michael Oliver's report.

379.title: Goa to face loss of ₹500 cr if visa curbs to UK not relaxed: GFP MLA
379.article_body: Goa Forward Party (GFP) President and MLA Vijai Sardesai has claimed that Goa will face a loss of ₹500 crore if tourists from the UK don't visit the state due to visa restrictions. He appealed to the BJP government to relax the restrictions. Sardesai claimed a minimum of 40,000-50,000 tourists, who spend ₹98,000 each, visit Goa from the UK annually.

380.title: Mahakal Corridor scheme formed under Kamal Nath: Congress
380.article_body: The Madhya Pradesh Congress has alleged that the scheme for the development and extension of Ujjain's Mahakaleshwar Temple was prepared under the rule of Kamal Nath in 2019. State Home Minister Narottam Mishra has denied these claims and said that Kamal Nath 'has a habit of lying'. Mishra added that the proposal for the scheme was prepared in 2017.

381.title: 44 Syrian migrants found inside truck in North Macedonia
381.article_body: Police in North Macedonia have detained 44 Syrian migrants, including 14 minors, who were discovered hiding inside a truck near the southern border with Greece, authorities said on Tuesday. The truck driver was arrested on suspicion of having links with a migrant-smuggling ring. The migrants were found inside a specially-constructed hiding place within the truck, as per local authorities.

382.title: DoT, MeitY to hold meeting with smartphone firms, telcos to resolve 5G issues
382.article_body: Top officials of the Department of Telecom (DoT) and IT ministry have called a joint meeting of smartphone companies, including Apple and Samsung, and telecom operators to ensure smooth rollout of 5G, including smooth onboarding of customers. The meeting will be held on Wednesday at the DoT office. Secretaries of both the DoT and IT ministry will chair the meeting.

383.title: 'Sign of weakness': NATO chief on Russian strikes across Ukraine
383.article_body: NATO chief Jens Stoltenberg on Tuesday said he believes that Russia's missile strikes on Ukrainian cities on Monday were a "sign of weakness" as Russian forces are unable "to make progress on the battlefield". "While Russia is increasingly resorting to horrific and indiscriminate attacks on civilians and critical infrastructure, President Putin is failing in Ukraine," Stoltenberg stated.

384.title: Condemn Russia's irresponsible nuclear rhetoric: G7 leaders at meet
384.article_body: The leaders of the Group of Seven (G7) nations have condemned Russia's "irresponsible nuclear rhetoric" and recent missile strikes on Ukraine. The leaders said the use of nuclear, chemical or biological weapons would invite "severe consequences". The G7 leaders on Tuesday held an emergency virtual meeting, which was attended by Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy.

385.title: Suzlon Group gets 144.9 MW wind power order from Aditya Birla Group
385.article_body: Suzlon Group announced that it has secured an order for the development of 144.9 MW of wind power projects for Aditya Birla Group. Suzlon will install 69 units of wind turbine generators (wind turbines) with a Hybrid Lattice Tubular (HLT) tower and a rated capacity of 2.1 MW each. The project is located at sites in Gujarat and Madhya Pradesh.

386.title: Govt mulls 233 GW new transmission capacity for renewable energy
386.article_body: The Ministry of Power said the government is mulling electricity transmission for renewable energy capacity of about 233 GW, latest by 2030, across the country. The ministry told members of Parliamentary Consultative Committee, "Planning of transmission system for integration of additional 52 GW potential REZ (renewable energy zone) by 2026-27 have been carried out."

387.title: More than 1,300 fans banned from FIFA World Cup 2022 in Qatar by UK
387.article_body: More than 1,300 fans from England and Wales with banning orders won't be allowed to travel to Qatar for FIFA World Cup 2022, the UK's Home Office said. "We will not let the behaviour of a minority of lawbreakers tarnish what will be an exciting tournament," said Home Secretary Suella Braverman. The banned supporters have a history of soccer-related violence.

388.title: Lakshya Sen moves to career-best No. 8 in world badminton rankings
388.article_body: Commonwealth Games champion Lakshya Sen moved up to his career-best eighth position in the Badminton World Federation (BWF) men's singles rankings. The 21-year-old Sen was previously ranked at ninth position. Notably, the Almora-born shuttler started the year with a gold medal at the Yonex-Sunrise India Open 2022 and was also a runner-up at the All England Open Badminton Championships.

389.title: Voting for Congress is voting for BJP: Sisodia to Himachal voters
389.article_body: Senior Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) leader Manish Sisodia on Tuesday told voters in poll-bound Himachal Pradesh that "voting for the Congress is equal to voting for the BJP". Legislators from Congress will join the BJP after the elections, claimed Sisodia. His comments came after BJP National President JP Nadda's speech earlier in the day in the state.

390.title: Digvijaya Singh asks Lalu Prasad Yadav to join Bharat Jodo Yatra
390.article_body: Congress leader Digvijaya Singh has asked RJD chief Lalu Prasad Yadav to join the ongoing Bharat Jodo Yatra as it will "send out a good message". Speaking at the RJD's national convention, Lalu asked all parties, including Congress, to come together against the BJP in the 2024 elections. He added that an Emergency-like dictatorial atmosphere prevails in India.

391.title: Ex-India head coach Kirsten joins Netherlands as consultant for T20 WC
391.article_body: Former India head coach Gary Kirsten has joined the Netherlands team as a consultant for the T20 World Cup. The team have also roped in Australian all-rounder Dan Christian into their backroom staff. Kirsten had worked with the team during their Super League series against Ireland last year and the team trained at Kirsten's Cape Town academy in September.

392.title: Govt ensured balanced, equitable development of every region: Himachal CM
392.article_body: Himachal Pradesh CM Jairam Thakur on Tuesday said the BJP government ensured balanced and equitable development of every region of the state in the last five years. Thakur inaugurated and laid the foundation stone for 183 developmental projects worth ₹1,008.42 crore from Kullu for various Assembly constituencies. For Kangra district, he inaugurated 28 developmental projects worth ₹108.98 crore.

393.title: US has been participating de facto in Ukraine war: Russian Foreign Minister
393.article_body: Russian Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov on Tuesday told state television that the Ukraine war was being "controlled by the Anglo-Saxons". "It seems to me that the Americans have been participating de facto in this war for a long time," said Lavrov. He also refuted White House national security spokesman John Kirby's claim that Russia had refused talks with the US.

394.title: Took us time to get used to conditions: Boucher on SA's series loss vs India
394.article_body: South Africa head coach Mark Boucher said some "soft dismissals" put his team under pressure in their seven-wicket loss against India in the third ODI in New Delhi. "It took us time to get used to conditions...India bowled really well with intent and aggression. We take from here some good lessons," he added. South Africa lost the three-match series 1-2.

395.title: BJP to contest all 60 seats in 2023 Meghalaya Assembly elections
395.article_body: The BJP has announced to field candidates in all the 60 seats in Meghalaya Assembly election, which is expected to be held in February 2023. Meghalaya BJP President Ernest Mawrie said people of the state are happy with the schemes implemented by the BJP-led central government. The BJP is an ally of the National People's Party-led coalition government in Meghalaya.

396.title: 17-yr-old boy arrested for 'marrying' 16-yr-old girl in Tamil Nadu
396.article_body: A 17-year-old boy has been arrested by Tamil Nadu Police in Cuddalore after a video of him 'marrying' a 16-year-old minor girl at a bus shelter went viral. The man who recorded the video of the public incident was also arrested by the police. The girl received counselling while the boy has been sent to a juvenile home.

397.title: 2 killed in explosion at illegal firecracker unit in West Bengal
397.article_body: Two persons including a teenage boy were killed and five others injured after an explosion at an illegal firecracker unit in West Bengal's East Midnapore. The owner of the house where the explosion took place had his firecracker manufacturing license lapse last year. A portion of the house's roof collapsed after the explosion in the room being used for storage.

398.title: Indian Railways' earning increases 92% YoY to ₹33,476 cr in FY23 till October
398.article_body: Indian Railways said that its total approximate earnings from April 1 to October 8, 2022, is ₹33,476 crore, registering a 92% increase on a year-on-year basis. In reserved passenger segment, the total approximate number of passengers booked during the period increased from 34.56 crore to 42.89 crore. Railways reported a revenue of ₹26,961 crore from reserved passenger segment.

399.title: I have spoken to Putin only once and that was about 18 months ago: Musk
399.article_body: Elon Musk on Tuesday tweeted, "I have spoken to Putin only once and that was about 18 months ago." He added, "The subject matter was space." Musk's tweet came after reports claimed that he directly spoke with Russian President Vladimir Putin before tweeting a proposal to end the war in Ukraine earlier this month.

400.title: Sourav Ganguly declines IPL Chairman post, to be out of BCCI: Report
400.article_body: Sourav Ganguly's tenure as BCCI President will come to an end next week when Roger Binny will replace him at the annual general meeting, the Indian Express reported. Ganguly was offered the post of IPL Chairman, however, he declined the offer, the report added. The BCCI won't back Ganguly for the post of ICC Chairman as well, the report stated.
